YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE:

Description:
The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will work at our corporate head office in downtown Toronto and assist in the cleanup and maintenance of our HR Master Data shared across multiple HR applications. The role is critical in bringing and maintaining consistency of HR data management practices across the organization.

Reporting to the HR Systems Manager, the Data and Reporting Analyst will collaborate with the HR Regional team, the Corporate HR team and the HR Systems teams to lead and deliver the HR data integrity project. The project will be run in 3 phases and the key responsibilities by phase outlined in the following responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Phase One: Discovery and Analysis

 Interpret national/provincial/federal regulations to determine implications to current HR data management and reporting practices.
 Identify system and business logic rules in data management to identify data quality gaps and business impacts. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes (e.g. client onboarding), policies, systems and data management practices.
 Audit existing data to identify issues related to accuracy, completeness and integrity. Interpret data issues to identify corrective actions for reporting practices.
 Identify opportunities to standardize and centralize HR data.

Phase Two: Data Cleaning and Data Management Standards

 Design the New Data Management and Reporting Practices to ensure HR Data integrity, accuracy and completeness.
 Seek out industry trends to generate and recommend alternative approaches to managing workforce related data and reporting.
 Test new data flows and remediate issues.
 Data Error Resolution by responding to, correcting and identifying the root of data errors - work with the Data Stewards (local payroll and HR use) to ensure HR data integrity, to clearly communicate errors, resolution procedures and new data management practices.
 Train Data Stewards in the application of the new data management practices, if needed.

Phase three: Maintenance of data - execute and optimize Data Management practices

 Support regional team in the maintenance of the data management practices. Serve as a Data Governance & Management communication point of contact to all stakeholders.
 Run bi-weekly Data Audits and correct triggering practice.
 Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to optimize the data management practices.
 Document finding regarding data challenges and corrections needs.

And all other ad hoc duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Qualifications:

 5+ years of experience on HR related projects with data impact.
 5+ years of experience as a Data Reporting Analyst
 Excellent working knowledge with MS Office applications (MS Excel in particular) and Visio.
 Knowledge of database principles and SQL language
 Strong organizational skills, prioritization and results orientated to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multinational organization (Canada, Mexico, Finland, Sweden).
 Systematic thinker, data and analytical abilities.
 Strong mathematical and literacy skills, complemented by excellent visual accuracy skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
 Experience with data manipulation, data transfer automation, analysis and reporting.
 Ability to interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems.
 Availability to travel in Canada and abroad.
 Languages: English (mandatory). French, Spanish or Finnish an asset.
Knowledge of:
o HR data concepts as they pertain to all HR processes and impact in other corporate processes (Accounting, Maintenance, Health and Safety, etc.).
o Process and data analysis practices and guidelines.
o Internal audit methodology and practice.
o Global HR processes, practices and technologies.
 Experience in:
o Previous experience using HRMS mandatory. Previous work with JD Edwards is an asset.
o Project Management or Change Management practices.
o Data mapping and data integrations between multiple systems.
o Data audits against multiple/complex criteria.
o Analyzing complex data from multiple perspectives and providing optimization recommendations.

Development and optimization of Power BI reports in desktop and apps to deliver simplified analytics to support insight development.
Provide analytical support by creating and sharing regular and ad hoc reports as required.

Architecture groups

Design Team

This individual will not have any direct reports but will need to influence approximately 2-10 FTEs, Permanent and Consultants.

Possessing a College certificate, or preferably a Bachelor’s degree specializing in Mathematics and Statistics / Computer Science / Business Analytics / or other quantitative field.
Experience
Between 2 and 5 years of experience in Analytics and Data Science
Assets

Experience working in a data warehouse/Business Intelligence or relevant data environment; in either a development or support role. (3+ yrs.)

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group. (3+ yrs.)

Experience in predictive analytics. 1+ yrs.)
Experience in understanding complex businesses questions and framing the right analytical question to solve a business problem. (2+ yrs.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group.
Understanding of statistics.

Ability to promote business intelligence, analytics, and reporting vision
Exposure to delivering commercially beneficial insights and analytics strategies.

Toronto, ONBrief Description:
The Marketing Analyst will derive insights from data for Wavemaker brands, and will serve as the primary analytics contact for client teams. As such, they will be expected to make recommendations for the activation teams based upon insights retrieved. Additionally, the successful candidate will establish a highly collaborative relationship with the analytics and activation teams, thereby contributing to the success of our clients.
Three Best Things About the Job:
Work in a dynamic team of data and analytics specialists serving high-profile brands
Drive innovative new approaches to automated reporting and data-driven decision making
Key Responsibilities of the Role:
Aids the activation team in measuring the success of media campaigns, comparing a performance to the client’s objectives and constantly seeking ways to improve the accuracy or timeliness of this measurement
Conducts client-specific analyses across all media channels and ensures that Wavemaker has access to the appropriate data. This could include building statistical models on how media affects key business outcomes
Routinely collaborates with the media team to arrive at recommendations supported by data and analytics
Develop and optimize machine learning models to support and strategize controllable factors based on exogenous and endogenous factors
Contributes to the design and measurement of new tactics deemed appropriate in furthering the client’s objectives
Collaborates with internal and external business intelligence groups on the development of various dashboards, pipelines and processes
What You Will Need:
Bachelor’s degree or above in a STEM field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Management (with emphasis on Marketing)
Minimum of two years of experience in a data management or marketing analytics role
Intermediate skills in writing and reading SQL, R and/or Python code
Intermediate skills in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Datorama or PowerBI (minimum 1-2 years in building dashboards)
Ability to query relational databases such as SQL Server or Azure SQL
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
Experience in working with data from various media channels including digital, search engine marketing, social, and traditional (highly preferred)
Experience in conducting business analysis to collect requirements from non-technical stakeholders, while managing their expectations at the same time
Experience in communicating technical terms to non-technical people, and helping them understand why change is required to achieve a specific goal or to complete a project
Knowledge of media analytics concepts, syndicated media data sources, third party ad serving platforms, and media buying platforms would be beneficial
Qualities:
An independent, self-driven individual with highly responsible nature
A team player with natural curiosity and a desire to do things differently
An understanding of the broader media landscape and its impact on communications campaigns and strategies
Desire to work in a dynamic, client-focused agency environment
Proactivity in seeking solutions to unique and complex problems
Methodical, organized, with high attention to detail
Ability to prioritize multiple projects
An energetic and proactive learner

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

Perform in-depth quantitative and qualitative analysis as needed to satisfy data reporting needs

Identify opportunities to automate reports that are required more than once, or build auto-refreshing dashboards for ongoing data needs.
Provide advice and guidance to internal clients on how to structure and manipulate ready data sets to answer given questions.
Participate in gathering business requirements for data solutions and for other Medical Education systems.
Represent unit at internal and/or external committees and meetings.

Undergraduate degree
Three (3) years' related experience

Proven experience designing and generating statistical reports, and analyzing results. Advanced proficiency in Excel (e.g., creating formulas, pivot tables) and PowerBI. Knowledge of One 45 and Banner systems experience is an asset. Familiarity with statistical packages such as SASS, SQL Server, Tableau is an asset. Able to understand instrumentation, devise technical solutions and contribute to define the requirements of business intelligence solutions. Ability to influence and build strong partnerships. Attention to detail and high level of accuracy is vital. Excellent consultative and collaborative skills, and tact and diplomacy with clients at all levels. Experience advising and giving workshops. Able to set priorities, solve problems, and take initiative with minimal supervision. Self-motivated, agile and driven to think out-of-the-box on key initiatives. English and French, spoken and written.

Markham, ONHyundai Auto Canada Corp. is headquartered in Markham, Ontario and is a subsidiary of Hyundai Motor Company of Korea. Hyundai markets a full line-up of vehicles in this country – from subcompact to premium sedans to sport utility and crossovers – and is committed to providing world-class, well-engineered products paired with a customer shopping and ownership experience that exceed expectations.

When Hyundai entered the Canadian market in 1983, it was the company’s first overseas subsidiary. Since that time, it has grown into one of the best selling automotive brands in Canada. Hyundai’s success can be attributed to the quality, safety, and design of its vehicles, which is reflected in numerous, high-profile awards they have recently won.

POSITION OVERVIEW: In conjunction with the Manager, Customer Loyalty & Acquisition, the purpose of this role is to drive business results through the development and execution of data analytics designed to meet the evolving business needs. He/she will support the CRM team through the development and delivery of data driven insights that drive engagement, acquisition, loyalty, retention and revenue.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Liaison with retail, brand, product, sales, aftersales and service to support campaign requirements, identify/recommend key campaign target audience selection including prospect and/or customer data using data-driven insights including loyalty, lapsed clients, behaviour and demographic patterns, to ensure optimized customer journey and response rates.
Utilizing the campaign management tool, set-up of acquisition and retention campaigns; data selection criteria based on the customer journey, segmentation and behaviors; generation of campaign lists; campaign deployment tasks.
Conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of strategies and refine them as needed.
Translate customer data into insights, which will form a strategy to meet business needs and improve customer acquisition, growth and retention.
Be able to generate insightful PowerPoint presentations based on the findings and effectively communicate them to any business audience
Responsible for running adhoc data queries, list pulling, data compliancy, and reporting.
Serve as the key analytics / business intelligence contact
Using our CRM database and BI tool, you will analyze and report on corporate and business KPIs, highlighting actionable insights - successes, trends and opportunities. Maintain formal process to update and share findings with marketing team and business stakeholders.
Create reporting on analytical insights and campaign performance, identify opportunities and recommendations for CRM to scale its conversion and retention functions, and recommend improvements on strategies used by our marketing and sales team across their campaigns.
Develop reporting BI dashboards to provide insights and visualization into customer, channel and campaign performance based on existing and new KPIs, historical performance, as well as ad-hoc reporting by marketing managers and stakeholders.
Act as project lead on key database enhancement projects including gathering and translating business requirements, data integration, and testing.
Support manager with continuous innovation in CRM initiatives, marketing tactics to acquire and nurture prospects to conversion along the customer journey.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

3 -5 years of relevant experience in the same or similar positions.
Completion of an undergraduate degree. ... or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
Strong analytical and data mining capabilities with proven experience in business intelligence tools (i.e. QlikView, Tableau, SAS BI, TIBCO).
Solid SQL skills is a must
Hands-on experience with campaign lists and deployment (including email campaigns).
Experienced with SAS campaign management tool (CI and SAS Enterprise Guide (EG) is an asset.
Experienced with Qlik business intelligence tool is an asset.
Effective project management, business analysis and database marketing skills. Attention to detail, strong oral and written communication skills and a get-it-done attitude.
Experienced in sharing insights using story-telling skills.
A self-starter who is tenacious and creative in finding ways to get things done
Independent, strategic thinker
Excellent problem solving-skills
Minimum of 3 years of CRM / database experience
Automotive industry a plus

We are committed to providing employees with an experience that will help them grow and develop professionally. Ideal candidates are self-starters, team players and thrive in a dynamic environment. If you are looking to build your career with a growing organization where you can use your knowledge, skills and talents, consider joining our team.

Hyundai Auto Canada Corp. is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We are also committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities and their accessibility requirements. If you require accommodation during the interview process, please let us know and we will take all reasonable steps required to meet your accessibility requirements.

We thank all applicants for their interest; only candidates selected to proceed in the recruitment process will be contacted.

The Company
-----------

Our mission is to connect the world's photographers. Every month, millions of people from around the world use our website and mobile apps to find, share, and get rewarded for the world's most inspiring photography.

------

The Job
-------

As a data analyst you will bring 500px's understanding of our Community and Licensing business to the next level and help us move forward confidently with data-informed decisions. The Data Analyst is responsible for contributing to creation of KPIs and dashboards, conducting business impact analysis, evaluating product usage and trends, and using data to find business growth opportunities. The Data Analyst reports to the Data Team Lead and will collaborate with Senior Leadership to influence Licensing related decisions and performance.

------

What You'll Be Doing
--------------------


Interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions through gathering information from various sources and interpreting patterns and trends
Conduct complex queries on our data warehouse to help teams get the data they need, and maintain key reports and dashboards to track operational and business metrics
Build and maintain dashboards and reports that enable the Senior Leadership, Product, and Marketing teams to: drive business decision-making, drive performance and answer business questions in a measurable and actionable manner
Tell data stories to stakeholders by drawing insights from data analysis, bringing insights together to formulate the story and making recommendations for actions
Help your cross-functional team with data reports and data discovery by optimizing self-serve BI solutions and providing SQL support
Develop data collection plans and ensure the integrity of data collected
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns of user features and activities
Analyze trends in image usage via image metadata, sales reports, categories and keywords
Work with the technology team to identify, implement and maintain the systems we need to collect, verify, and analyze behavioural data
Define standards for data quality, and support the technology team in meeting those standards
Communicate and distribute data insights, tailoring presentations and findings to audiences across all levels of the organization

------

What the Ideal Candidate Will Have
----------------------------------


A Bachelor's or Master's degree in statistics, computer science, math, physics, or a related quantitative field
1-2 years professional experience of consultation to internal groups or departments
Expert knowledge of statistical sciences: statistical modelling and data mining
Expert knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL
Proficiency in querying MySQL and Redshift databases
Excellent analytical skills including cohort analysis, funnel analysis, AB testing, and lifetime value analytics
Hands-on experience with Python and/or R.

You'll get bonus points for:

Experience with community based platforms
Experience with commercial licensing an asset
Knowledge of third party tools like Optimizely, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Braze
Knowledge of advanced data analysis topics such as: causal inferences, data simulation, or correlated data analysis (e.g., survival analysis, longitudinal analysis, time series analysis and forecasting)
Working experience with python libraries for data wrangling, visualization, mining and modelling (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Statsmodels, SciKit-Learn, NLTK)
Working experience with R packages for data wrangling, visualization and modelling (e.g., reshape2, dplyr, stringr, lubridate, ggplot2, car, forecast, randomforeset, Caret, survival)
Knowledge of business intelligence such as SaaS metrics, time series forecasting, or pricing analysis
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL

------

Perks
-----


Interesting technical challenges
Competitive salaries
Flexible hours
Catered lunches, snacks and drinks
Great health and dental benefits
Professional development opportunities

------

Our Interview Process
---------------------


Phone screen: < 30 min conversation with a hiring manager
Tech challenge: a take-home test to analyze a sample of0pxdataset and build an insightful presentation
In-person interviews: 3-5 hours at our office where you'll meet multiple members of our team

------

Diversity
---------

We believe diverse teams perform better, and we seek to increase our overall team diversity. We make active efforts to reduce the impact of unconscious bias in our hiring process.

PermanentReporting to the Manager, Field Services, the Junior Data Analyst will break down performance data and create reports on team and individual operational performance. The Junior Data Analyst will identify, document and track performance metrics as well as support the teams with information to help drive performance.
Key Responsibilities
Maintain, support and distribute and improve existing reporting/analytics solutions
Explore new ways to automate reports that summarize and transform data from various data sources into understandable, actionable information
Present and clearly communicate findings and results with stakeholders, team members and project teams for performance improvements.
Collaborates with the Field Managers and Supervisors to determine approaches and methods to improve the overall operational performance of work.
Provide support to teams that require deeper dives into data for operations failure causes
Required Knowledge & Skills

A strong understanding of Excel and demonstrated Project Management type experience
1 to 2 years related work experience
Excellent analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills

Demonstrated ability to build strong, cooperative interdepartmental relationships

Toronto, ONWho We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.
BEworks is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are proud to be in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005 and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment (if applicable) process as required under BEworks' policies and procedures. Applicants must make their accommodation needs known when first contacted by the recruitment team.

Toronto, ONJob Description
IBM is seeking a Risk Analyst to strengthen the IBM Algo Risk Service and Data Management Teams.

IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud offers hedge funds, asset managers, pension funds and other buy-side organizations access to an award-winning web-based portfolio construction, financial risk management and reporting service without the costs or challenges of an in-house deployment. Offering bundled data, it provides a wide variety of simulation-based risk analytics that enable portfolio managers, traders, risk managers and senior executives to take a proactive approach to financial risk oversight and investment decision making.

The Role

Risk Analysts work in a multi-disciplinary group (business leads, technical consultants and core Development teams) to support the IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud framework or to assist in Data Quality and Validation. This framework involves data, analytics and reporting services that employ Risk Analytics Algo One applications. Working from an existing legacy platform, consultants assist in the transformation to a dynamic and flexible Cloud based risk service integrated with a proprietary Data Service.

Our team works collaboratively and members are encouraged to explore and develop unique ways to solve challenges employing advanced quantitative finance techniques. Projects require individuals who are able to research and experiment to develop new ideas and solutions. Working with an open and constructive mindset, guidance and feedback is available from the broader group.


Responsibilities :
Provide subject matter expert advice to internal and external audience for risk management topics including financial markets operations, product valuation methods, scenario based risk analysis and risk reporting standards.
Own functional projects related to feature extensions including interaction with development team (team & core), research and client service teams. Involves independent scope setting, task determination, priority setting and development support
Consulting with sales and pre-sales to present Service capabilities to prospects. Identify and fill gaps where necessary.
Investigation of data sourcing, transformation and storage for use in the risk management process. May involve extensive communication and negotiation with external vendors.
Investigation and remediation of client support issues (3rdlevel support).
Work with Development team to improve the core software offering.
Competencies and Skills :
Theoretical understanding of financial economics, mathematics and statistics.
Practical knowledge of financial markets and risk management standards.
Practical knowledge and experience around financial instrument valuation methods and (stochastic) scenario generation techniques.
Strong research and problem solving skills.
Familiarity with data science languages such as R or Python.
Written and oral presentation skills. Must be able to convey complex ideas to a functional and technical audience.
Technical aptitude including use of computer networks, Linux operating system and client/server applications.
Education :
University degree in the field of Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
Advanced degree in Financial Engineering or Mathematical Finance is beneficial.
CFA, PRM or FRM designation(s) beneficial.
**NOTE: the successful candidate will need to work from our 185 Spadina Ave office on a regular basis**

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry working with front or middle office portfolio risk management systems.
Experience in an advanced technical environment – collaborating on or writing scripts or code, integration, testing and deployment.
Experience with financial market data such as Reuters, Bloomberg or Interactive Data applications.

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

N/A

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

$50,000 - $55,000 a yearAre you ready to infuse your career with excitement? Do you relish the opportunity to use your analytical and data mining expertise to impact and influence success across multiple business lines (financials, marketing and field performance, operations and more) in a highly successful organization?

If this sounds good to you, Steeped Tea is looking for you: our new Data Analyst / Administrator.

You’re an experienced Data Analyst or Administrator, with strong SQL, communications and problem-solving skills, who wants to positively impact a company that’s as driven as you are. You’re passionate about precision, and love generating smart plans from relevant data and maintaining multiple databases.

About Steeped Tea

It all started with a cup of tea. In the last ten years, Steeped Tea (http://www.steepedtea.com/) has turned tea lovers into business owners. Today, Steeped Tea has been recognized year over year as one of PROFIT 500’s Fastest-Growing Companies. We are the biggest success story in Dragon's Den history, partnered with David Chilton and Jim Treliving.

Steeped Tea is a direct-selling company manufacturing, blending and distributing premium loose-leaf teas and accessories through a network of thousands of Independent Consultants across North America. We empower others to start their own business and generate an income by selling Steeped Tea products directly to consumers in their community.

Data Analyst / Administrator

Reporting to the Finance Director, with responsibilities across the organization including IT, you will play a key role in maintaining our databases and running recurring / adhoc reports informing our business on key strategic and tactical insights that support our sales, marketing and financial decisions.

Your main goal is to ensure that the business has accurate and accountable data to maintain historical integrity and that the business has key analytics and reports in order to make smart decisions.

Your contributions will provide the foundation for our short- and long-term goals and build opportunities for business growth and our future success. Your extensive experience with SQL, query writing in MS SQL Server and Excel tools will allow you to mine and analyze data and create reports to facilitate excellent decision processes.

You will be a valued influencer and contributor across all business lines. Succeeding here is as much about relationships, as it is data, and so your communication and listening skills are key. And as we progress towards a more data driven business model, your technical skills will be as important as your eye for detail, passion for problem solving, and aptitude for analysis

Practically speaking, you will:

Maintain Steeped Tea’s consultant database ensuring the accuracy and timely execution of data entry and systems integrations to maintain historical integrity
Report monthly on business financials, marketing and field performance, and operation metrics with insights on efficiency/effectiveness using SQL and Excel tools.
Conduct ad hoc data analysis and reporting for the organization to assist in the data analysis of various user platforms to improve ability to analyze and project trends to monitor business performance.
Run and model sales promotions and marketing programs to provide recommendations that improve cost efficiency/effectiveness and guide future promotions and programs.
Maintain and build an accessible knowledge library of published data dictionary reports as well as data management documentation for communication and education
Assist with the transition and onboarding to a new analytics software platform

This role is deeply involved in all aspects of our business and offers an excellent career building opportunity. If that sounds exciting to you, then we can’t wait to meet you.

Working at Steeped Tea

At Steeped Tea, it’s our goal to create an entrepreneurial and creative environment that is both challenging and rewarding. We love what we do and are inspired to outperform every day. You’ll see the impact of your work on the business every single day.

This is an 18-month contract opportunity with a competitive salary ($50,000-$55,000/year), and comprehensive benefits plan (health, dental, vision, etc.).

Office hours are Monday to Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. in our Ancaster office.

Qualifications

Here’s what we’re looking for:

Experience in a similar data analytics or administrator role, ideally in a manufacturing, production or distribution environment
Experience providing insights into sales, promotions, and marketing programs
Significant experience with SQL and query writing in MS SQL Server is a must
Experience with Web based hosting service, Azure, HTML, CSS an asset
Expert level knowledge of Excel (VBA, macros, pivot tables, master sheets)
Post-secondary degree or diploma in business, marketing, commerce, finance, or a related field
Experience with any of the following software is an asset: SSRS, WMS, Party Plan Solutions and IDSTC and/or Izenda
Experience in a direct selling organization is an asset

How to Apply

Our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person – not just a resume. The application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.

We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in, and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button.

We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

These solutions could include data or development recommendations, or a combination of both. Be part of the project team that integrates Manufacturer build data into our system for consumption
Able to navigate and utilize appropriate query software (Kibana Elasticsearch Queries)
Generate and present queries, reports and dashboards to help identify data, product and feed issues
Receive and respond to customer reports of errors, and proactively respond with corrections and status updates in a professional manner
Qualifications:
Able to work well under pressure and to excel in a constantly changing environment
Strong self-management and analytical abilities
Very high accuracy and attention to detail is required and must be demonstrated in decision making and entry of information
Computer skills – MS office, excel, word
Post-secondary education would be an asset
Experience with Kibana Elasticsearch software or similar query & reporting programs would be an asset
Strong knowledge of VIN data and how it ties to vehicles would be an asset
Strong knowledge of Vehicle Ordering and Pricing data would be an asset
This role requires flexible hours (including OT) which may at times include early mornings, late nights and weekends
For more information about Autodata Solutions, check out our website at www.autodata.net.

BE authentic. BE collaborative. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International. Join our team as a Data Compliance Analyst in downtown Toronto.

We’re looking for an analytical, detail oriented professional to join our data intelligence department. You will be responsible for gathering and recording of contact online consent data in a CRM system, and be the go to for any Anti-Spam legislation. Apply today!

At Colliers International, we are building amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

Who you are

You are an analytical person with a keen eye for detail, who is able to analyses large data sets to look for inconsistencies, track changes and communicate to clients or internal stakeholders if we are outside of the Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation. You are also an out of the box thinker, who can approach data compliance challenges with innovative solutions and also strive to increase accuracy of all information in the CRM+ system.

What you bring:

One plus years of experience in data compliance or analytical field, including exposure to CRM tools or similar databases.
Ability to manage and prioritize your work, with excellent attention to detail.
Proficiency with MS Office including MS Excel.
Bonus skills and experience

Knowledge of Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation.
Experience with CRM system.
Previous experience in real estate is considered a strong asset.
What success looks like:
You have excellent attention to detail to record and track contact consent data in a CRM+ system to provide clear and up to date information for Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation compliance.
You maintain an accurate, up to date and comprehensive record for all entities in the system.
You take initiative to work proactively with team members to grow the business acting as an advisor.


BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers International. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

lululemon athletica
Founded in 1998 in beautiful Vancouver, BC, lululemon athletica creates components for people to live long, healthy and fun lives.

A day in the life of the Data Analyst
The Data Analyst is an exceptional analytical thinker who is passionate about identifying product assortment insights and sales trends using analytics. This individual will be responsible for ensuring accuracy of product data, monitoring product performance and guest feedback, building analytical models to isolate driving factors, and communicating findings to business partners to inform product strategy. Working in teams of diverse skillsets and backgrounds, the Data Analyst works on projects tackling the most difficult problems facing our Product functions.

Core accountabilities
Monitor key product performance indicators using transactional, product, and guest dataBuild and maintain analytical models to identify opportunities in product and assortment strategyChallenge assumptions and ways of workingCollaborate with business partners to implement change to business processes and workflowsIdentify opportunities for data process automation within Product functions; develop and implement automated workflows

The Finer Print
Bachelor’s degree in a rigorous quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, economics, physics, etc.2-3 years of work experience in data analytics, preferably in the retail or apparel industriesExceptional analytical and problem solving skills, including demonstrated creativity in problem solvingExcellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skillsStrong proficiency with data modeling in MS Excel and MS Power QueryExperienced with data visualization tools such as Power BI or TableauBase proficiency in SQL, database management, and database structuresBase experience with systems integrations and the software development lifecycle

Intellectual curiosity and ability to learn quicklyComfortable dealing with ambiguityProven work ethic with utmost integrityDesire to excel and succeedActively live and breathe the lululemon culture and lifestyleSelf-motivated, passionate, empathetic, and approachableTeam player and personable

Toronto, ONContractAs a Senior BI Analyst you will work independently on complex information management activities that include the identification of source data (multiple source systems); responsible for data analysis & documentation; data mappings; SME on the source business processes and systems; retrieval of data from information management environment through the use of SQL query and different analysis tools.

Significant expertise in translating business requirements into technical specifications.
Experience of leading requirements gathering activities using workshops and interviews (with client teams'). Proficient in Business and Systems Analysis techniques.
Develops excellent documentation including, but not limited to, Business Requirements Document, Systems Functional Specifications (Use Cases), BI Reports/Dashboard Specifications, Data Dictionaries, System/Data Architecture, System Assessment Report, Data Mapping document, User Acceptance Test Cases etc.

Solid communication skills to work with client teams to identify and document data integration requirements including but not limited to source data identification, data mapping document (from source-to-target), data transformation requirements, data quality, data integrity requirements etc.

Qualifications:
BS in Information Systems, Computer Science/Engineering or related discipline.
8+ years of hands-on experience as a Senior Business Analyst (ideally in Business Intelligence projects).
Able to produce quality documentation.
Ideally, involved in a data warehouse development project from start-to-end. Skilled in developing Source-to-Target data mapping documents.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to research, identify and resolve data integration issues.
Ideally skilled in MS Excel and SQL query writing for data extraction, analysis, scrubbing, cleansing, reporting etc.
Working knowledge of data warehouses such as SQL Server, Oracle, Amazon Redshift, Teradata etc. is ideal.
Please note this is a one-year contractual position in Qatar.

Ottawa, ONTemporaryThe Credit Insurance group has undergone an extensive transformation and is now ready for the final phase which entails moving a large number of clients from our old legacy systems to our new Credit Insurance Suite platform. We are creating a separate team which will manage the end-to-end conversion process and require a Data Analyst to be a part of this team and exciting initiative.

Discipline Summary

As an expert resource on data analysis, dashboards, and impact assessment design and implementation, the Data Analyst will contribute to the achievements of the Credit Insurance objectives by supporting the design and use of effective data-driven tools for impact assessment, monitoring, measurement and benchmarking/reporting.

Key Responsibilities

Determines the best source of information to suit the users’ needs and develops queries and reports;

Provides analysis of query/report output, conducts statistical analyses and interprets results;

Identifies data integrity issues and determines feasible solutions and maintains documentation, templates, procedures, processes, and standards relating to data;

Performs all aspects of the data lifecycle management including consulting with business users to articulate requirements, translating the requirements into viable solutions, testing and deployment of solutions.

Qualifications

Screening Criteria

Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or in a related field

Minimum 2 years’ experience in business intelligence and reporting or related experience

Experience in developing clear and consistent processes and tools for data collection, monitoring, learning, and reporting that enabled teams and/or clients to own and implement monitoring or reporting frameworks

Basic knowledge of business intelligence and reporting principles and practices

Experience using database platforms for data collection, cleaning, aggregating and report generation

Intermediate skill in Excel, especially with functions, formulas, data aggregation and basic VBA understanding

Assets

Bilingual in both official languages

Location

The position is based in Ottawa.

Salary Range

$52,000 - $79,000

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

JOB TITLEData Analyst/Research FellowSUPERVISORSteven Hoffman, Director of the Global Strategy Lab; Patrick Fafard, Associate Director of the Global Strategy LabDEPARTMENTGlobal Strategy Lab (www.globalstrategylab.org)APPLICATION DEADLINEApril 19th, 2019POSITION OVERVIEWThe Global Strategy Lab is hiring a Data Analyst/Research Fellow to support our global legal epidemiology research program. The Global Strategy Lab advises the world’s governments and public health organizations on how to design laws, policies and institutions that address transnational health threats and make the world a healthier place for everyone. Past studies have focused on access to medicines, antimicrobial resistance, health news misinformation, pandemics and tobacco control. This position represents an opportunity to conduct quantitative and mixed-methods research in social science and public health, to work across national borders as part of a globally integrated research team and make tangible contributions to ongoing policy processes on pressing health issues. This position also provides opportunities for professional development, including opportunities to learn new quantitative research methods and to attend and present at academic conferences. Candidates must have a graduate degree in a related discipline or be nearing completion of their degree by the position start date.As a staff member, the selected individual will help execute various quantitative research projects in collaboration with GSL’s Directors and Research Associates. The Research Fellow will assist with secondary data collection and analysis, conducting systematic reviews, preparing grant applications and REB submissions, and with manuscript writing across a range of new and existing projects.BASIC REQUIREMENTSGraduate degree in a related field (e.g., epidemiology, health research methods, quantitative political science, health economics)Ability to understand, interpret, and conduct quantitative health researchExperience with social sciences research preferably related to public health issuesStrong ability to work independently and in teamsAttentiveness to detailWillingness to take initiative and to learn new thingsInterest in social science research on global health, governance and institutional designExperience using statistical software package (e.g. Stata, SAS, R, SPSS)PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (BUT NOT REQUIREMENTS)Experience working on interdisciplinary mixed methods research projectsExcellent writing skills and demonstrated ability to write for multiple audiencesExperience working with, and mentoring, undergraduate research assistantsKnowledge of basic health concepts and willingness to learn scientific terminology as it arisesRESEARCH FELLOW RESPONSIBILITIESProvide a full range of research support to the GSL team with focus on quantitative researchCoordinate the collection, delivery, entry, verification, analysis and reporting of dataEnsure that relevant research methodology is applied, and all research material is handled in accordance with established protocols, policies and proceduresSupport the design of new studies and the analysis of resultsConduct literature searches and environmental scansAssist in the preparation of manuscripts for publication, abstracts and grant applicationsPrepare submissions and updates to research ethics boardsSupport integrated and end-of-grant knowledge translation activitiesCOMPENSATION AND TERM OF EMPLOYMENTThe Data Analyst/Research Fellow will be based at York University. Annual salary will depend on the candidate’s experience and qualifications. The successful candidate is expected to work approximately 40 hours per week.HOW TO APPLYPlease submit a brief cover letter, CV and writing sample saved as one file. Applicants who fail to submit all three documents will not be considered. Please quote Job #545168 in the email subject line. Only successful candidates will be contacted for interviews, which will take place in person or via video conference the week of April 22nd.Official job post: https://globalstrategylab.org/news/gsl-hiring-data-analystresearch-fellow-apply-nowThank you in advance for your interest.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:quantitative research: 1 year (Required)Education:Master's Degree (Required)

FreshBooks has an ambitious vision. We launched in 2003 but we're just getting started and there's a lot left to do. We're a high-performing team working towards a common goal: building an elite online accounting application to help small businesses better handle their finances. Known for extraordinary product and customer service experiences and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries.

The Opportunity - Senior Data Analyst - Lifecycle

The Senior Analyst will enable FreshBooks to derive insight from campaign and customer interaction data to generate growth via increased Trial to Pay conversion rates. You love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with your manager and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.

What you'll do:

Consult directly with internal clients to gather requirements, scope & execute:
Dashboards for core performance metrics
Complex analyses on customer trends and long-term performance
Understand the impact of business decisions and able to provide recommendations using the data
Able to identify possible areas of improvement and drive change through working with multiple stakeholders

A/B testing for campaign treatments
Email Send, Open, CTR, CTA etc review
Changes in trial usage behaviors (organically and due to marketing)
Profiling and trending of customer segments
Cohort based investigations tied to performance gains and losses
Plan selection and optimization
Designing, writing and implementing new reports, datasets and business intelligence tools to productionize 'valued' ad-hoc analyses
Assist with forecasting

Advanced knowledge of SQL & Python or similar
At least 3 years in data analytics and/or business intelligence
Advanced knowledge of Excel (external data connections, macros, VBA, etc)
Quantitative background with strong analytical skillset
Experience using a dashboarding tool such as Periscope, Tableau, Looker etc

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Canopy Growth is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain Analytics team. As a Data & Visualization Analyst, you will help lay the data foundation of the company to be data driven. You’ll have a chance to collaborate with various teams in the supply chain and logistics organization to understand different data and reporting requirements.

The ideal candidate has the following traits:

Passion to be surrounded by data and finds excitement in diving into the deep end to extract insights others don’t see
Is detailed oriented and has the ability to react quickly in a dynamic business environment
A passion in unpacking and solving complex problems
Work with structured and unstructured data to solve problems like:
Identifying and centralizing data to be the most trusted source of information in the company
Assist the business in realizing the value and importance of data in their respective business areas

Responsibilities

Define ETL processes for consolidating data from transactional / operational systems
Build and expand the data dictionary
Produce regular reports and analysis using a range of data analytics tools
Support the business in creating ad hoc reports and troubleshooting reports
Be the data evangelist and help enable the business to be power users
Drive data quality improvements and collaborative effort towards unified enterprise Business Intelligence services
Write systems queries using SQL (MS SQL and MySQL), workbooks (MS Excel & Google Sheets), and other platform-specific query languages
Track project and task requirements, issues, deliverables, and acceptance criteria for reports and dashboards
Other tasks as assigned

Experience

Understanding of Supply Chain functions and data requirements (planning, procurement, logistics, transportation, scheduling, etc.)
Experience with a range of data analysis and presentation tools such as Excel and Google Sheets, Tableau, Power BI, SSRS, Cognos, Splunk, Sumo Logic, Salesforce Einstein, Crystal Reports, ZAP BI/SDMA etc.
Desire for tailoring your work into user-friendly dashboards in enterprise ERP and CRM platforms (SAGE X3, NetSuite, SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)
SQL knowledge and ability to write complex queries
Understanding and ability to build OLAP Cubes, Dimensional and Relational Data Models
Comfortable with ETL, integrations, field mappings, and other data dictionary responsibilities
Experience performing statistical, time series, and cross-sectional analysis on large data sets a plus
Python data programming experience (R, NumPy, Pandas) a plus

Other Details

This is a Full Time position based out of the Ontario Area. Must be able to travel to Smiths Falls on a regular basis to collaborate with internal clients.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
At Loblaw Companies Limited, our purpose – Live Life Well – supports the needs and well-being of Canadians who make one billion visits each year to our stores.
Ambitious, right?
We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond the limits of what’s comfortable. Our goal is a relentless customer-first commitment. We analyze. We challenge. We connect. We are innovators. And what we are achieving is revolutionizing the retail and digital advertising industry. By transforming data into knowledge, we provide our partners a deeper understanding about their customers — who they are and what they are about.
Loblaw Media offers a new way to plan and deliver meaningful digital advertising to help consumer brands more effectively reach customers who will love their products. We use transaction-based insights from our online and bricks and mortar stores to target and measure campaign effectiveness.
Bringing our mission to life requires amazing people and the right workplace. We have a diverse team of experts who want to take ownership and make an impact. People who are energized by collaboration and passionate about solving complex problems. People hungry to venture well beyond their corner of the business to discover new products and new ways of doing things. We have gathered this cross-functional team in a unique and open loft-style space in downtown Toronto.
Your job description starts here, but it ends where you’re willing to take it…
Loblaw Media is hiring a Data Analyst with a background in web development. In this role, you will be using advanced techniques in obtaining and analyzing data so as to obtain information in a time-efficient manner; as well as be comfortable developing and supporting basic web interfaces that automate processes and display data. You will work closely with account management and execution teams and will prime data management along with data mining, modelling, manipulation, visualization, and reporting.
What You'll Do:
Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases.
Develop capabilities to identify areas of opportunity and improve processes and efficiency on reporting.
Work with IT in terms of identifying opportunities to make key information more easily and reliably accessible.
Act as gatekeeper with regards to security and confidentiality of data obtained through all sources.
Translating business requests and questions into SQL logic. Business requests can be strategic nature or tactical focus, including but not limited to initiatives about in-store activities, CRM initiatives, marketing promotion, etc.
Extract, review and prepare sales and customer behavior data for analysis, reporting using SQL
Analyze data to help determine insights to solve business problems
Work collaboratively with Product, Sales and Marketing and Operations groups, on cross functional projects and initiatives
Support with designing and deploying advanced campaign performance reporting dashboards
Support with designing and delivering, and maintaining enterprise-wide / in-production analytic solutions
Troubleshooting issues related to data and analytics, including the management of ad-hoc reporting requests
Support with developing data driven insights and analytics presentations to internal and external stakeholders and partners
What You'll Bring:
Mandatory: Programming skills with Python. Optional: Scala or R.
Mandatory: Experience with Django Framework, HTML, JavaScript. Optional: React, Angular
University Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, and Mathematics is preferred
Experience with Hadoop and understanding of its components (HDFS, HBase, Spark) is an asset.
Data mining experience working with a large relational customer database
3 years experience in utilizing advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools (MS SQL, Unix, Linux, IBM Netezza, IBM DB2, Teradata).
Experience in BI platform (Power BI, Microstrategy, Cognos, SAS, etc)
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A Team player and self starter
Advanced MS Office skills (Excel, Word, Access)
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
