The Position:
As the Data Analyst Intern, you will be joining a growing and creative environment as part of the Lifecycle team. In this role, you will have an opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals within the field of water services. You will gain exposure to technical and commercial aspects while supporting the Lifecycle team to support our equipment install base and assist the greater organization in achieving its annual goals and objectives as an active participant.
Nature of work:
In this role, your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):
 Compile information about the install base of SUEZ Water Technologies & Solutions (SWTS) plants to help the LC team better service our customers
 Help create reports and proposals for new areas of product sales based on findings from big data analytics
 Perform a variety of administrative, product and project specific duties to support the Lifecycle team.
 Influence and actively participate in the business objectives of the Lifecycle team globally.
 Analyze data from a variety of databases (Salesforce, SAP, internal systems) and bring forth actionable business insights
 Provide technical expertise and assistance with the ETL of big, unstructured datasets
 Help drive optimization, testing and tooling to improve data quality
 Solve complex data modeling and other analytic problems
 Be one of the leaders in the revamping process of constructing a data centric lifecycle aftermarkets team
 Ad hoc duties as required
Compensation: Annual 0.00 - 0.00 CAD
Is relocation for this position offered:
Number of Job Openings: 1
Company Grade/Band: Other Salaried
SUEZ’s Water Technologies and Solutions (SWTS) offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation.
WTS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Mississauga, ONThe Data Scientist represents the foundation of a data driven culture that has made Wal-Mart an leader in the retail industry. Individual in this role will use a wealth of ecommerce, physical store and external data available to understand customer behaviour improve operational efficiencies and provide actionable insights to stakeholders so they can make smarter, data-driven decisions.
The successful candidate will have an established background in solving complex problems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and the motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. Our team is small, creative, diligent, highly entrepreneurial and business-focused.

Position Responsibilities
Extract data using data mining techniques to uncover trends and derive insights; analyze forecasting metrics, perform exploratory data analysis with the goal to uncover trends, find root causes of forecast inaccuracies and develop innovative features that can drive additional value
Solve complex data science problems using the breadth of tools available at Walmart – including problem framing, data preparation, model building, model deployment and output consumption in the form of dashboards
Manage stakeholder expectations and design data science solutions which align with our pillars of maximizing revenue, reducing costs and improve customer experience
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results concisely and persuasively to stakeholders
Highly driven, results-oriented, creative and a problem solver with an ability to prioritize and set direction in a fast moving environment; Possess a curious attitude with collaborative and resourceful working style
Enable others in the organization to utilize your work by sharing your work as well as act as an ambassador for Data Science within Walmart Canada
Canada Walmart DivisioneCommerce
Qualifications
Degree in a STEM discipline (applied mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, machine learning, econometrics etc.)
Familiarity with the consultative process which cater to the internal clients’ advanced analytics needs
Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms
Knowledge of building time-series models by taking into account dynamic variables
Good knowledge of best practices in Statistics and Machine Learning
Strong project management skills
Fluency in Python/R and familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop
Must be able to explain technical concepts and analyses implications (tell a data story) clearly to a wide business audience/possess excellent communication skills, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
Experience in e-commerce or a related field is an asset
AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

You will be reporting to the Upstream Stewardship and Planning Manager in Calgary, AB. Working as a member of a high profile financial and business reporting team made up of technical professionals, you will have the ability to interact with many parts of Imperial’s Upstream business. You will be responsible to support important business reporting functions, ensure long term data and record integrity, and build expertise in corporate plan data and systems.

This is an example of a few key responsibilities but are not limited to:
Work with Excel-based databases and PowerPoint visuals to source, summarize, and present data that supports business planning, decision making and cost stewardship.
Assist the Planning team with data summarization and presentation deliverables related to the annual company plan, monthly stewardship and ad-hoc business requests.
Serve as the central point of knowledge for location and types of existing planning-related data; become an expert in knowing where to get the data and what the data and stats include. Maintain centralized/organized planning, stewardship and actual cost set of data.
Primary user of planning softwares; responsible for data inputs, outputs, data maintenance, and software optimization.
Provide IT-related data management and maintenance support; interface with internal IT teams for system troubleshooting and diagnosis.
Communicate and interface regularly with global counterparts and local planning team to support daily work scopes


Learn more about our new Calgary Quarry Park Campus.
Qualifications
Academic:
Bachelor’s degree in business information systems or computer degree (CIS/MIS) is preferred
Computer science and software development designation or experience is an asset


Other:
2-5 years of relevant experience
Strong attention to detail
Strong problem solving and mathematical skills
Expert with MS Excel and PowerPoint
Must be able to prioritize and work to tight deadlines
Initiative to drive continuous improvement
Fast learner – must be able to learn new skills and software quickly
Proficient with use of MS Excel Visual Basics (VBA) and Macro development
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Proficient with use of Sharepoint, including new site development and/or maintenance
Ability to translate/communicate between IT and business
Data analytics, machine learning and big data management would be useful for driving efficiencies but not a requirement for base role – primary focus of role is data management and presentation


Start date: June 2019

Locations: Calgary, AB
Your benefits
Imperial’s focus on continuous learning and professional development ensures that there is always a new challenge around every corner. We believe that a strong future is built on solid beginnings. Whether it’s through job rotations, training programs or our specialized networking and mentoring programs, Imperial puts your personal development at the forefront.
Commitment to safety, ethics & continuous improvement – these standards are the reason Imperial is an industry leader. You will work for a company that upholds safety and ethics ideals and continues to seek out ways to improve.
Exceptional benefits program - includes competitive savings, retirement, and healthcare plans that you can customize to meet your individual needs. Educational and physical fitness financial assistance programs round out our benefits package.
Continuous learning environment - encourages you to augment your skills and capabilities.
If you are talented, driven, and want to make meaningful contributions, then you owe it to yourself to apply with Imperial.
Competitive vacation package - provides you with three weeks of vacation (the first year is pro-rated based on your hiring date) and one scheduled Friday off per month.
Who we are
A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. No matter what your career path, we provide the platform to elevate your goals and achieve your ambitions, while providing support through wide-ranging programs and benefits.

Other considerations
For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.
We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
Initial positions will be located in Calgary AB. Subsequent positions throughout your career at Imperial may be located in other cities across Canada.

Eligibility to work in Canada
All applicants who receive an offer of employment must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date. Proof of eligibility shall be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence, Canadian open work permit or receipt from Immigration Canada of an application for a post-graduate work permit . Proof of eligibility must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Proof of eligibility will be required if an offer of employment is made. Failure to provide proof of eligibility at least six (6) weeks prior to the start date may result in the offer of employment being rescinded.

Application deadline: April 7, 2019
Imperial is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals.
In certain situations, Imperial may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions in the company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.

Descartes (TSX:DSG) (NASDAQ:DSGX) is the global leader in providing on-demand, software-as-a-service solutions focused on improving the productivity, performance and security of logistics-intensive businesses. Descartes has over 220,000 connected parties using its cloud-based services. Customers use our modular, software-as-a-service solutions to route, schedule, track and measure delivery resources; plan, allocate and execute shipments; rate, audit and pay transportation invoices; access global trade data; file customs and security documents for imports and exports; and complete numerous other logistics processes by participating in the world's largest, collaborative multimodal logistics community. Our headquarters are in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada and we have offices and partners around the world. Learn more at www.descartes.com.
POSITION SUMMARY
Reporting to the Senior Director, Finance & Corporate Controller, the Analyst, Master Data will be responsible for ensuring that all data pertaining to contract maser data records are set up and maintained with high quality. The successful candidate will work closely with teams across the business to support the creation and ongoing maintenance of customer and contract data, ensure data entry guidelines and policies are adhered to, and serve as a subject matter expert.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Support and enforce established data standards and guidelines related to master data.
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help to resolve data quality problems
Understand and communicate master data updates (e.g., maintenance, new fields, definitions, etc.) to business teams, as required.
Review and analyze daily reports to ensure completeness and data accuracy and action accordingly.
Ensure timely and accurate execution of all requests received for the creation and maintenance of master data including enrichment of data, as required.
Serve as the subject matter expert in master data creation /maintenance
Participate in adhoc data cleansing projects and testing, as required.
QUALIFICATIONS
University degree, background in business/ finance/ accounting is an asset.
Experience/ knowledge of SAP and working with master data is an asset.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.
Must be detailed oriented and highly organized.
Ability to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
LOCATION
Waterloo, Ontario
OFFER
We offer a flexible and casual work environment, as well as mentorship and on-the-job training to support your personal growth. You will have an opportunity to contribute new ideas and we welcome your fresh perspective.
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS
Please submit your resume and a covering letter describing why you are a unique fit for this position, to jobsna@descartes.com citing “Analyst, Master Data” in the subject of your message. We thank all applicants for their interest in Descartes; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Agency calls will not be accepted. All final candidates will be required to provide professional references and complete a background check, which will include a criminal background check and may include a credit check and verification of education and previous employment.

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

Data Reporting Analyst - Vancouver

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”


If this sounds like you, come on board with a global organization, and one of Canada’s 50 Most Admired Corporate Cultures!

Job Description:
Major Job Functions:
Provide financial and statistical business analysis to support and drive business initiatives
Prepare and distribute various internal and externally circulated reports and analysis on a daily, weekly, monthly & quarterly basis
Develop various types of reporting from simple queries and one-time data pulls to complex models and dashboards
Assist OEM’s Senior and Value Stream General Managers in organizing data for the purposes of profitability meetings, attending those meetings as required, and providing data analysis expertise and support related to takeaways that come from them

Management of ongoing internal processes as required and assigned (ex: rebate claiming, revenue forecasting, transfer pricing maintenance)
Specific Skills & Knowledge:
Possess intellectual curiosity, with a creative mind and strong problem-solving skills

Comfortable to pick up and learning new software and technologies quickly
Comfortable and proficient working with, cleaning, and connecting large data sets; this includes both structured ones within and outside of databases, as well as non-structured ones

What's Bench? Check us out in Georgia Straight ( https://www.straight.com/life/1165331/bench-accounting-and-11-other-metro-vancouver-companies-make-deloittes-prestigious ), Fit Small Business ( https://fitsmallbusiness.com/bench-ceo-interview/ ),Inc.com ( http://www.inc.com/bartie-scott/bench-mental-health-guide.html ), FinTech Impact ( https://www.fintechimpact.co/podcast/bench ), the blog ofPerkins + Will ( https://officesnapshots.com/2017/04/25/bench-accounting-offices-vancouver/ ) and ourInstagram ( https://www.instagram.com/benchaccounting/ ).

We're a passionate and fun group of people working hard bring financial mastery to 1,000,000 people. For many small business owners, keeping up to date on their books means less time spent growing their businesses. Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of our clients hands. We've paired our intuitive (and quite beautiful) software with a team of dedicated bookkeepers to provide monthly bookkeeping at an accessible price, giving entrepreneurs the time and the confidence to run the businesses they love.

Bench is post Series B, capitalized by a team of Silicon Valley and New York investors. We're scaling fast and we're not slowing down anytime soon. In just a few short years, we've grown from four co-founders to over 350 Benchmates. We're looking for the brightest minds to join us on this incredible journey, in pursuit of bringing financial mastery to our clients.

Data Analyst

The Data Analytics team plays a key role in driving the understanding, growth, and success of Bench. Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics, you will combine technical know-how with a deep understanding of our business and clients to make an impact across the entire data value chain at Bench:


You'll work closely with our Data Engineering team to ingest product and business information into our data warehouse;
You'll collaborate with other analysts and subject-matter experts to summarize high volumes of raw data into a useful form;
You'll be a sought-after resource by analysts throughout Bench for your subject-matter expertise on data infrastructure, analysis techniques, and data visualization.

Ultimately, your work will spawn insights that help Bench leadership and decision-makers to make informed decisions.

Here are some of the things you'll get up to:

Take in and clarify requests made of the Data team by stakeholders across Bench
Interpret and transform raw data to produce high-quality data sets for use by business users and other analysts
Build dashboards and reports to monitor business and operational metrics

The Essentials:

2-5 years progressive experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or similar roles
You balance an enthusiasm for learning and new ideas with a keen eye for detail
You have a healthy skepticism and are good at finding and pointing out flaws in quantitative reasoning (including your own)
You are unafraid of speaking up and out to make our ideas and lives better, communicating your thoughts effectively and with empathy
Post-secondary degree in Engineering, Science, Economics, Business, or other quantitative discipline (or equivalent experience)

Technical skills:

Hands-on experience using data visualization to tell compelling stories (Tableau, PowerBI)
Familiarity with querying relational databases using SQL (PostgreSQL, Amazon Redshift, MySQL)
Exposure to one or more programming languages commonly used for statistical analysis or data science (eg. Python, R)
Proficiency with Excel or Google Sheets

Other Details:

This is a full-time permanent position because we want to spend lots of time with your wonderful self
This position offers a competitive salary and stock options based on experience
Our office on Robson Street (easily accessible via transit) is dog friendly and the fridge is always stocked compliments of Bench
We offer an extended benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, massage, and a monthly Lifestyle Spending Account

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

We are a digital product consultancy that plans, produces and manages digital products for clients, who operate in a diverse and broad range of industries and digital product types. This is a full-time, permanent position.

Measure, monitor, predict

Genuine passion for digital strategy and digital products
Takes initiative and proposes new ideas and solutions before asked
Flexible and productive when juggling multiple priorities

Robust Medical, Optical, Dental, and Extended Health Benefits plan

Toronto, ONJob Description
Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $60 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $140 billion. We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Vision
Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Values
Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride.

At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:
Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them.
Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge.
Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work.
Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.
Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader.

The Corporate Solutions Technology department within Mackenzie Investments is accepting applications for the position of Data Systems Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Systems Analysts & Architecture the successful candidate will be part of a small/agile team working with the Investment Management Division.
The Data Systems Analyst maintains a “business perspective” through all phases of the project and works with the entire IS project team to assist in the planning, designing and launching of new solutions in support of our growing business needs.

What we are looking for:
2+ years of experience working with business principles and different types of business data.
Post-secondary degree/diploma in a related discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Information Systems Management).
Technical expertiseregarding data models, database design development, data analysis and reporting tools.
Knowledge of and experience with reporting/ business intelligence software (Tableau), databases (SQL, MongoDB), programming (Python, SQL).
Analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Understanding of IS Methodologies, processes and practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Planning and organizational skills with the ability to adapt to change and perform effectively under pressure.
Primary responsibilities will include but not limited to:
Liaise with business stakeholders to understand business objectives to design the solution that will meet their needs.
Elicit requirements from business stakeholders through interviews, workshops, business scenarios, and user stories.
Analyze system data requirements and model the data design to deliver to business requirements.
Design data acquisition and storage techniques for data from primary or secondary sources.
Query and review large data stores to understand the transactional information and business rules that govern the data. Identify outlying data patterns and data cleanliness issues for resolution.
Investigate and respond to data issues raised by business stakeholders.
Document the system specifications for the software development team.
Ensure the quality of the solution by testing the development results meet the business requirements.

job_title: Community Based Researcher and Data Analyst
job_description:
Ottawa, ONContract$50,000 a yearConditions


6 month employment contract with possibility of extension

35 hours per week at $50,000 per annum pro-rated to six months

Some evening and weekend work required


This is a six month employment contract with possibility of extension subject to funding and successful performance evaluations.

Background and Context

This is a full time position for six months to assist our Geographic Information System specialist on a range of data projects. The primary project will be to help develop an Ottawa Neighbourhood Equity Index (NEI). The NEI is a tool to assess and compare inequities and opportunities at a neighbourhood level on factors impacting wellbeing. The purpose of the tool is to assist decision makers and community organizations in developing plans to reduce inequities, leading to more equitable outcomes across neighbourhoods. It also allows for better identification of systems-level issues and can inform resource allocation. The NEI presents evidence-based data providing an indication of wellbeing at the local neighbourhood level. It is based on the World Health Organization (WHO)’s Urban HEART (Health Equity Assessment and Response Tool) framework.

Duties and Responsibilities

The “Community Based Researcher and Data Analyst” is responsible for the gathering, formatting and analysing the data relevant to the project. The responsibilities include data visualisation and research assistance.

Duties include:


Acquire and organize data from internal and external partners

Perform data manipulation and data analysis tasks, including spatial analysis / geo-processing

Generate high quality cartographic products as well as related graphs, charts and data tables using digital mapping and visualizing tools

Prepare documentation and communication products (e.g., technical design documents, model documents, MS PowerPoint presentations etc.)

Conduct literature review and other research in support of the project

Provide updates on progress made to manager(s) on a regular basis


Requirements


Excellent ability to work with data, including data gathered by and from agencies (especially qualitative)

Advanced Excel skills such as formatting, creating formulas and graphs

Very good knowledge of analyzing datasets using statistical programs (Excel, XLSTAT SPSS, SAS etc.)

Very good community based research skills

Very good skills in writing documentation and communication products

Some knowledge of data visualization

Well organized with a demonstrated attention to detail

Ability to work in a group or independently

Good knowledge of basic computer programs

Some understanding of project management skills

Relevant education or comparable experience


Assets


Significant assets

Experience using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software for spatial data analysis (QGIS, ArcGIS, etc.)

Understanding of / experience with web-based mapping

Very good knowledge of cartographic design and mapping principles

Web design


General assets

Ability to work in English and French

Good understanding of population health and/or social issues

Experience with knowledge mobilization strategies with population health and social service stakeholders

Experience in program evaluation

Toronto, ONTucows is a quiet, but very successful, twenty-year-old global Internet services company. From its humble beginnings as a software sharing platform, Tucows is now the world’s second largest domain registrar and provider of wholesale Internet services, and through its brand, Ting, is revolutionizing mobile and Internet access in the U.S. Today, 600 Tucows employees work in 10 offices worldwide and help generate over $300 million in annual revenue. Description:
Tucows is looking to add a new member to our Analytics, Insights and Reporting team. Together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, and related business intelligence operations within our quickly growing company.
We’ve got a lot of data, and we’re looking for someone to help us get the most out of it. To do that, you’ll need to be comfortable working end to end in the data pipeline; from extracting data from source systems into our data lake, to building visualizations and dashboards in Looker and everything in between.
You will work with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to understand their needs and priorities, as well as to collaborate and ensure that their reporting requirements are captured in the development process. You’ll then build and work with data pipelines, acquiring data from source systems and moving it through our data hierarchy, from messy and raw to clean and aggregated. Lastly you’ll explore the data with visualization tools and statistical techniques to help make our products better and to improve the experience of our customers.

Top-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
Excellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentation
An interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical data

1-2 years of quantitative analysis work experience
2+ years experience handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports
Strong expertise with an SQL language, as well with as database structures and data lake architectures
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Suite
Nice to Have:

Experience with Looker
Proficiency with Python
An understanding of the principles, tools and processes of data science
Oracle PL/SQL
Experience with Kafka
Education:
Post secondary education in a technical field, or B.S./M.S.

job_title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)
job_description:
DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)

POSITION CODE: 2019-079
LOCATION: The Globe and Mail, Toronto
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Data Analyst with strong fundamental skills in data analysis and visualization. This role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. The primary responsibilities for the analyst will be to model large volumes of data to design and implement custom reports and dashboards, and perform complex ad hoc analysis using raw data to extract useful insights and identify key trends.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis: Modeling and interpreting large volumes of data, identifying trends and extracting insights. Reporting the results and insights back to the relevant stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Create, maintain, enhance and automate various dashboards and reports that provide insights into user behaviour while keeping in mind business needs and goals.
Requirement Gathering and Documentation: Assist with documenting data sources, relationships between data entities and business concepts, and methods of calculation and measurement while understanding stakeholder needs.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:
Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience working with Level of Detail, Table, and Window functions in Tableau.
Experience working with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Teradata, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
Command of analytical SQL (ex. Window Functions & Frames, Group Sets, Cubes, Rollups, etc.)
Experience with of at least one of the following: Python, Scala or JavaScript.
Knowledge of inner workings of various web analytics tools (i.e. knowledge of beacons, data processing and enrichment)
Comfortable working in a ‘self-serve’ capacity as a data analyst (i.e. retrieving and modeling your own data when so required).
Experience gathering stakeholder requirements with a demonstrated ability to get to the bottom of specific business rationale
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines
REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Data Visualization skills and at least a year of experience working with Tableau
Working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Omniture or Google Analytics
Good understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Working knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods
Experience deploying tracking via Tag Manager(s)
OPTIONAL BUT DESIRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience working with AWS
Experience working on Linux systems (shell scripting, vi, cron management, etc.)
Experience using Git
Experience with managing Analytics and Marketing tags (via a tag manager or inline)
Experience in directing and teaching non-technical stakeholders on use of analytics tools



THE GLOBE AND MAIL INC. IS DEDICATED TO EQUITY IN THE WORKPLACE
At The Globe and Mail, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

POSITION PURPOSE
Sustainalytics is seeking qualified ESG analysts to join its ESG analyst team. This new position presents an exciting opportunity to conduct company ESG analysis that will form a part of our newly-released flagship ESG Risk Rating. Asset owners, investment managers and other investment professionals leverage the ESG Risk Rating and its underlying research to enhance investment processes. The role involves ESG risk and controversy analysis for companies, as well as contributing to client meetings and thought leadership. You will join a growing and strategically important team and contribute to the development of a vibrant community of sector analysts. You will engage in training and development programmes which support your career development to become a top ESG analyst. The ideal candidate will have both a background in capital markets and sectoral expertise. We are currently hiring for the Mining and Materials sector and the Oil and Gas sector.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Research, analyze and rate the ESG risks and involvement in controversies of companies in the mining or oil and gas sector.
Prepare company ESG Risk Rating reports to be published in Sustainalytics’ Global Access portal;
Research and track ESG trends and issues relevant in your sector of expertise;
Contribute to responding to client queries and support clients in integrating your research insights into their investment decision-making;
Contribute to the development of intellectual capital and internal and external thought leadership.
QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate degree in related discipline (business, finance, environment and/or social science);
At least 2 years of relevant work experience but we are ready to welcome more experienced candidates as well;
Strong knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry and SRI/RI market;
Knowledge of mining or oil and gas industry processes and technologies is considered an asset
Capital markets background; MBA/CFA considered an asset;
Excellent research, analytical and writing capabilities;
Presentation skills (both in spoken and written formats), e.g. ppt skills, client interaction skills;
Alignment with Sustainalytics’ mission, vision and values;
Resourceful, flexible and embraces change and innovation;
TO APPLY
If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, please submit your application using the form below. All applications will be treated with the highest level of discretion and will be accepted until close of business on March 31, 2019. However, as we will start interviewing sooner, we advise you to apply as soon as possible.

In keeping with our ongoing efforts to represent the diversity of our community, we strongly encourage people from diverse groups to apply. Sustainalytics is committed to providing accommodations for individuals with disabilities, upon request.

Sustainalytics thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those applicants requested to participate in the interview process will be contacted. Sustainalytics accepts applications directly from applicants only; no employment or recruitment agencies, please.

Your privacy while being in contact with Sustainalytics is one of our fundamental commitments here. Review our Privacy Policy to find out more about how we handle the personal data you provide us during the recruitment process. Should you have any questions or concerns, contact us at Data Protection.

Toronto, ONAbout us

Delphia's mission is to ensure your data is working for you. As a first step towards that end, we are building an online marketplace in which people can invest their data as assets, control how those assets are used, and realize the economic returns that their data generates. Through our various apps and services, we're building a new kind of company that re-thinks the value of privacy, data rights, and provenance to ensure your data always works for you.

Delphia is a growing (~25 people), multi-disciplinary team located in the heart of downtown Toronto. We started in January 2018 and have already graduated from Y Combinator and raised a sizeable Seed (led by Lerer Hippeau & Golden Ventures) and Series A (led by Real Ventures) rounds of investment, with continued interest from the investment community.

Whether we're tweaking the more delicate details of your data portfolio’s UI, or extracting signal from giant data sets, people at Delphia are creatives at heart. Our teams are continually iterating, solving hard problems, and collaborating to generate new forms of value and economic returns for our users. Working together, we want people to realize the real value of their data – and we're just getting started.

About the role

Delphia's market forecasting team is looking for a Data Scientist with a proven track record of building successful financial machine learning forecasting models. You will develop factors and models that can forecast various quantities of interests on thousands of companies worldwide by applying your analytical and predictive modeling expertise. You will generate and evaluate hypothesis that leverage our proprietary mass attitudinal and behavioural datasets in combination with social media data to fundamentally improve the Delphia's market forecasting abilities

Data Scientists at Delphia work closely with Data and Software Engineers to discover, prototype, and deploy factors and models at scale to accurately predict mass attitudes and behavior in order to understand and forecast large market shifts. You will work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones, solve complex forecasting problems and continuously improve the performance of our financial machine learning forecasting models.

You will also develop metrics and generate reports to measure and illustrate the value of ongoing experiences.

About you


You are passionate stock markets and finance and can easily generate hypothesis around factors that drive various markets.
You are an analytical problem solver and creative thinker that is passionate about machine learning and has outstanding analytical and modeling skills allowing you to quickly operationalize ideas and implement prototypes to validate an hypothesis.
You enjoy exploring and identifying patterns in data, develop and improve predictive models, and are interested in exploring any methods capable of efficiently and effectively generate features and improve forecasts on complex problems.
You can easily split problems and objectives into small experiences and continuously illustrate the value of your analysis while trying to reach longterm objectives.
You are a pro-active self-starter capable of taking responsibility for an initiative and working with minimal direction towards a broader objective.

Qualifications


3+ years experience with time-series modeling and forecasting including statistical analysis and machine learning techniques such as forecasting hierarchical or grouped time series, dynamic regression models, neural network models.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to explain technical concepts and analyses implications clearly to a broad audience and translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Bachelor's degree or higher in an analytical area such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other relevant field.

Toronto, ONWe’re looking for candidates who are on top of their game. Find out what it’s like to work at Economical: https://youtu.be/C2mu-vLY_0Q
WHY ECONOMICAL?
Because a changing industry calls for a new way of doing things. An ambitious, innovative and fast-paced company, we offer exceptional training and development programs, competitive pay, great benefits, a company-matched savings plan, and paid volunteer days — all within an engaging, fun, and collaborative work environment.
Founded more than 145 years ago, Economical is one of Canada’s leading property and casualty insurance companies. We rely on our national network of more than 800 independent brokers to sell a range of car, home, business, and farm insurance solutions. With Sonnet and Petline, we’re extending our reach through the direct-to-customer channel. With more than 2,400 active employees across the country and a commitment to rethinking the insurance experience, we’re poised for great things.
We’re now adding to our high-performance team to take us into the future. Let’s rethink insurance, together.

$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@visoinc.com with the subject title “Business Analyst”.

We look forward to receiving your resume!

job_title: Technical Analyst, Sustainable Technologies Evaluation Program (STEP)
company_name: Toronto and Region Conservation for the Living City
job_description:
$51,852 - $57,954 a yearPOSITION OVERVIEW:
Contract Duration: 11 months
Reporting to the Manager, STEP the Technical Analyst is responsible for providing technical expertise, research and writing services and project management support to the Sustainable Technologies Evaluation Program (STEP). This position will also provide support in the collection, quality control/quality assurance (QA/QC), analysis and reporting of monitoring data under supervision.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform the following tasks under general supervision:
Provide technical expertise, research and writing services and project management support to the Sustainable Technologies Evaluation Program (STEP).
Assist with coordinating the development and ongoing maintenance of the STEP databases.
Provide assistance in the processing, analysis and synthesis of data as required, and support in translating technical data and information into publicly accessible formats.
Assist with preparing communications materials for the STEP website and distribution at meetings, workshops and conferences. These materials may include project reports, technical briefs, case studies, web site content, posters and presentations.
Present results of STEP projects at meetings, workshops and special events.
Assist in organizing meetings, workshops and seminars on themes related to STEP objectives.
Assist with preparation of funding proposals, progress and monitoring reports.
Assist with managing sub-contracts with universities, consultants or other agency partners for specific monitoring projects.
Respond to inquiries related to monitoring projects and develop and maintain effective relationships with project partners, other external agencies and the public.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Post-secondary education in environmental science, engineering, physical geography, or equivalent.
Minimum of 1 year experience performing the major tasks of the role.
Experience in field monitoring, data analysis, technical report writing and web communications.
Valid Driver’s License.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Excellent client and customer service skills.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.
Proficient with computer word processing and spreadsheet software; experience with statistical analysis software an asset.
Working knowledge of watershed ecosystems, stormwater management practices, green infrastructure, stream water quality, QA/QC procedures, and technology monitoring and evaluation concepts.

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

This is a highly visible role across the organization that will challenge your ability to work with ambiguity, manage large amounts of data, turn insights into action, and make strong connections with business leaders. You will be working independently with category business managers, building relationships and Interpreting category, brand, and vendor strategies and their impact on price. You will have the opportunity to develop and implement new or existing frameworks that improve our customer’s price perception, while maximizing our categories profitability. In this role, you’ll work across a team of high performing individuals looking to make an impact at Canadian Tire.

What you’ll do

Work with Senior Pricing Analyst to become experts on the products they support and the pricing strategy applicable to their division. Use this knowledge to work with merchandising teams to help them understand how the strategies in place impact their business and find areas of opportunity

Use competitive insights, category framework, price optimization tool, reporting and other product specific knowledge to determine optimal pricing at a SKU level

Work with the Pricing Specialists to ensure SKU level changes are executed accurately and in a timely manner

Use competitive information compiled by shoppers and Pricing Specialists to maintain web scraping inputs and outputs for the SKUs within their division

Monitor competitive index for all SKUs within their division and work with senior analyst to determine best course of action to resolve any products that may stray from the desired index

Responsible for report generation and analysis for the team

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

1-3 years’ experience in an analytical role

Solid communication skills and problem-solving skills

Strong knowledge of MS Access, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint

Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced business environment

Merchandising and/ore retail experience is an asset

Knowledge of the automotive industry is an asset

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. The Privacy Analytics Data Services team is seeking a Data Analyst to develop expertise in re-identification science. A university degree with a strong focus on mathematical/statistical modeling and computer programming is expected. The ability to gain information from various sources and apply them to new and complex problems is also critical for success in this role. Expertise will be required to understand and communicate in a clear and concise manner what constitutes acceptable risk when releasing a health care data set.

Further to formal training and on-the-job coaching in this role, responsibilities will include re-identification risk assessments, methodology reviews, and risk management support to clients. This role helps manage the risk to the public and clients seeking to anonymize their data.
Responsibilities:
Develop expertise in re-identification science and de-identification standards, including cross-sectional and longitudinal data, microdata, tabular data, and remote access systems
Conduct qualitative and quantitative risk analysis for a variety of clients in and outside of the healthcare domain, and document the results of these analyses in client-facing reports and presentations
Inform the development of algorithms and recommend improvements to core software products
Facilitate, conduct, and coach others on the use of various risk analysis techniques
Act as a go-to resource for marketing and sales teams in support of go-to-market and sales activities
Travel may occasionally be required for conferences, training/coaching, and/or certain client workshops
Essential Qualifications:
B.Sc in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
5 years of relevant work experience
Strong mathematics and statistics skills are essential
Strong computer programming skills, especially pertaining to data analysis and modeling (e.g. R, SQL, Python, Java, Scala)
Ability to work within one or more project teams and manage multiple projects at various stages of development
Willingness to take initiative
Decision making and problem solving skills
Ability to present work and explain findings to senior leadership and clients
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Asset Qualifications:
A post graduate degree and research experience
Knowledge of re-identification science, statistical disclosure control, or privacy laws
Previous consulting work, as this role involves frequent contact with clients
Course work or training in risk based problem solving and risk based decision making
Experience working with health, financial, or marketing data
Experience with algorithm development with subsequent validation

Job Description
Job Summary:
The E-Commerce Control Analyst is responsible to support risk controls for e-commerce verification services by authenticating internet submissions; identifying, investigating, and actioning issues for resolution, and escalating key e-commerce control issues to Investigation Services management. The analyst will work with our various internal departments including Investigative Services, Technical Services, GBIS, Customer Service, and H&D Operations for resolution on e-commerce submission issues.
Key Accountabilities:
Analyzes data to identify anomalies, trends and patterns; and supports development, testing, and documentation of new flags for continuous review of all internet submission activity (5%)
Validates irregular internet transaction activity through phone calls with providers and secures evidence on discrepancies as part of information gathering on suspect claim submission activity (10%)
Requests supporting documentation from plan members and authenticates information, identifying issues and gaps for further review and resolution (20%)
Identifies fraudulent claims and documents and gathers evidence through interviews with plan members and providers (25%)

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.

Analyst, Energy and Climate Change
Permanent, Full-Time

The Analyst, Energy and Climate Change will be responsible for the development and implementation of
conservation demand managements programs, energy efficient measures and broad environmental, climate
change and energy management initiatives. This role will develop, monitor and maintain the Corporate
Management Energy Plan (CEMP), Municipal Energy Plan, Climate Change Adaptation Plan and the
Corporate Environmental Action Plan. The Analyst, Energy and Climate Change will research available
government grants and incentives and will explore strategic partnerships to identify and fund energy
efficiency and environmental projects. The Analyst will also provide interpretation of relevant legislation and
regulations and develop best practices, guidelines, policies and procedures to ensure the Town is in
compliance.

To be considered for this position you will have a university degree in Civil/Environmental/Mechanical
Engineering and/or a discipline related to environmental sustainability such as Planning or Architecture.

Professional accreditation or eligibility with the Association of Professional Engineers of Ontario or
membership with the Canadian Institute of Planners and Ontario Professional Planners Institute and
designation as a Registered Professional Planner (RPP). A Certified Energy Manager (CEM) designation,
Greenhouse Gas Inventory Quantifier or be working toward one of these designations would be considered
an asset as would accreditation through Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (e.g. LEED Green
Associate, LEED AP). A minimum of (5) years of demonstrated experience with demand conservation,
delivering energy management and environmental programs including monitoring procedures, quality
assurance/control concepts, construction and environmental protocols. You will have sound knowledge of
energy management and environmental principles related to federal, provincial, and local agencies with
strong emphasis on issues of energy policy, renewable energy and climate change. You will have thorough
working knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Ontario Building Code, Plumbing Code,
Municipal Act, Technical Standards and Safety Act and other applicable energy and safety-related
legislation/regulations/guidelines. Strong project and time management, organizational, problem-solving,
conflict resolution, report writing and presentation skills are required as is the ability to deal courteously and
effectively with all levels of staff, government, general public, developers, rate-payer groups, consultants,
contractors, etc. Excellent analytical, lifecycle costing and graphical interpretation with the ability to extract
patterns and trends with models from real world data sets. The incumbent may be required to attend evening
meetings and work outside of regular business hours from time to time.

Police Criminal Record Check Requirements
Successful applicants to this position will be required to provide a Police Criminal Record Check that is
satisfactory to the Town prior to their start date.

Markham, ONOverview
The incumbent prepares samples for processing and maintains process documentation to facilitate microbiological analysis procedures. This position reports to the Supervisor of Microbiology.

Job Duties
Prepare media and broth for use in microbiological testing as designated. Sterilize materials needed for analysis. Ensure that media and materials are prepared for the next testing sequence.
Prepare sample for analysis by recording, weighing, and blending. Retrieve samples from designated areas (e.g. log-in, sample storage).
Read plates and tubes, as designated, to determine the number of organisms in the sample. Record findings on worksheet for verification.
Write identification onto plates so that client and sample number can be tracked. Set up equipment and materials needed for analysis.
Pipette sample solution into tubes or plates according to the analysis process being performed. Pour the agar into plates or tubes to begin the growth process.
Collect plates/tubes/bags and place them in the incubator for the specified amount of time and temperature.
Perform calculations and input results as requested.
Perform rapid method tests as designated.
Interact with other department personnel to maintain smooth flow of work.
Update logbooks, transfer data and maintain records.
Perform necessary housekeeping duties in a timely manner, keeping the work areas and equipment clean and sanitized.
Must participate in cleaning schedule and maintain retain samples as required.
Train analysts where required and participate in the training programs.
Maintain knowledge of Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) that is required to complete job responsibilities.
Support corporate quality and continuous improvement process. Perform necessary tasks related to quality control parameters for the function being performed.
This position has the responsibilities and authority to identify departures from the management system or test procedures and document such observations in accordance with the prescribed non-conforming system and notifies the supervisor.
Responsibility to support laboratory management in the implementation, maintenance, and improvement of the management system.
Adhere to all safety policies.
Perform other related tasks as needed.

The incumbent must have a basic knowledge of microbiology to accurately perform testing procedures and obtain accurate results. Analytical skills are essential to complete analysis procedures and determine the concentration of the microorganism. A general knowledge of the Laboratory Information Management System is required to process client data. Physical dexterity is required for measuring, pipetting and transferring sample into plates and tubes. A basic knowledge of personal computers is useful to accurately enter testing data and results. A basic knowledge of laboratory safety procedures and policies is necessary to ensure a safe working environment. Have a working knowledge of the internal IQA and TQM programs. Planning skills are useful to maintain supplies of analysis materials and ensure analysis is completed within specified time.

As a Data Analyst at Vendasta you will ask questions and discover the answers. For the Existing Enterprise division, you will be responsible for building and maintaining a variety of data channels required for monitoring business intelligence, success metrics, and user behaviour.

You will report directly to the individuals prioritizing your work and will leverage the interdepartmental analyst group to review, develop, and share information and analyses. The Data Analyst will be articulate, analytical, and a team player who understands the power of data. The Analyst must enjoy coordinating with interdisciplinary teams, learn quickly, and be comfortable working independently.


Responsibilities
Respond to ad hoc requests from various stakeholders, prioritizing tasks based on business value and urgency
Build and interpret internal dashboards and data, analyze results, and provide ongoing reporting
Provide prompt reports on monthly, quarterly, and yearly results for the division
Acquire data from a variety of sources to monitor business intelligence, analyze trends, and assess user behaviour
Assist with the generation of key SaaS metrics required to gain visibility into business performance
Monitor, maintain, and leverage Vendasta KPI databases to surface timely business intelligence
Assist with data gathering strategies that align with company goals
Push requirements to Vendasta Business Intelligence teams to leverage their tech/strategy
Coordinate with management to prioritize business and information needs
Develop and implement databases and other systems that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure that required quantitative data is accessible, reliable, and maintainable
Assist product teams with the interpretation of quantitative data to aid in decision making and strategic planning
Skills & Qualifications
Experience performing statistical analysis
Competent in cleaning and formatting data
Proven ability to analyze and model data
Ability to interpret user behaviour data and collect associated metrics, such as NPS score, heat/scroll maps, conversion funnels, etc.
Familiarity with calculating key SaaS metrics (ARPU, Net MRR Churn Rate, LTV, CAC, LTV: CAC Ratio, etc.)
Familiarity with Google Cloud Infrastructure, App Engine, and tools (Bigquery, Data Store, Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.)
Familiarity with databases and various querying techniques (SQL, NoSQL, API)
General knowledge of Python and agile development practices (would be considered an asset)
Knowledge of design principles and data visualizations
Awareness of key users to surface actionable insights (partners, local businesses, Partner Success Managers, Sales Reps, vendors, etc.)
Continuous learner with a drive to explore new technologies and processes
Analytical business sense as aligned to division strategies and goals
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with a strong pursuit for truth and accuracy

primarily in in the office environment, but will involve frequent visits to operations areas

Data Reporting Analyst - Vancouver

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”


If this sounds like you, come on board with a global organization, and one of Canada’s 50 Most Admired Corporate Cultures!
