We are looking for a Data Scientist who is excited to play an integral part of a client facing team, who excels at uncovering concise business insights, and who can both deliver and communicate these insights effectively to external stakeholders. Responsibilities for this role range from data ingestion to collaborating with both internal and external stakeholders to build the platform in a way that best suits our client's needs. This is a fascinating role that requires both strong interpersonal skills and deep technical knowledge.

What you will be doing:

Using your data science super-powers to advise clients on everything from use case development to solution design to performance measurement
Collaborating with other Data Scientists on the team to problem-solve and develop best practices
Consistently delivering quality work as a member of our client engagement team, while keeping client love and trust at the forefront of all your work
Principally delivering data ingest for our client data, including cataloguing the data and mapping it to our proprietary data schema
Collaborating with our business team to create polished data visualizations and pull high level business insights from client data
Working closely with our machine learning team in the early stages of statistical/machine learning model development to identify valuable patterns and information in the data
Collaborating with our solutions engineers to translate complex business logic into our proprietary data schema
Supporting solutions engineers to do systems integration work with our clients
Sending feedback to our platform engineering and product teams to develop requirements for our product roadmap - specifically our ingest, structuring, and integration capabilities

You have:

5+ years in a lead Data Science role, including experience providing strategic guidance to clients and fellow Data Scientists
An appreciation for the beauty of data. You love a challenge, and you're excited about bringing a narrative to complex business problems using what you learn from a dataset
Worked directly with clients and understand the importance of prioritizing client needs
A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline
Strong technical abilities, creative problem solving skills and high adaptability
Extraordinary interpersonal, organization and communications skills
Experience working directly with business users to build reports and answer business questions with data
Experience working with big data structures and ETL tools and other big data technologies (Hadoop/Spark, Hive SQL, etc.) to uncover meaningful business insights
A good understanding of statistical modeling and you're passionate about deriving insights from large datasets
Programming experience with Python, R, or SAS
Adaptability and interest in working with a dynamic, early stage company

The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai's team members helps us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth.

We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team environment where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.

About Us

We are changing the way utilities manage our most precious resource: water. We provide water utilities with an Artificial Intelligence driven platform to help their staff make smarter decisions in real-time when operating their critical processes (i.e. water treatment, pumping etc). In doing so, we’re able to help utilities drive down their costs, enhance reliability and reduce risks to public safety.

We are thinking about the future, too. We are reimagining how the operational staff of the 21st century will interact with their critical infrastructure.

The Right Candidate

In short, we’re looking for impact-minded software engineers, data scientists and architects – those who are passionate about making the world a better place through artificial intelligence. You’ll be responsible for maintaining data structures behind billions of dollars in critical water infrastructure for Fortune 500 companies. We’re looking for ambitious, energetic, and talented individuals to join our purpose-driven community as you bridge the technical and business worlds to deliver products for the global water sector. You’ll have the opportunity to lead teams in building mission-critical systems and services for high profile clients globally using cutting-edge cloud technologies in an agile environment. We’re looking for individuals with a broad set of both management and technical skills.

What You'll Do


Build and optimize highly scalable, robust machine learning modelling pipelines for real-time applications
Optimize and scale in-house technologies such as optimization algorithms for industrial applications
Develop natural-language processing solutions, which augments internal data-model for robust and intelligent virtual assistants
Develop and augment pattern recognition solutions for large-scale anomaly and extreme event detection and root-cause analysis

What you’ll need


1+ years experience with cloud technologies, specifically AWS
3+ years experience with Python Data science libraries (numpy, pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, etc)
2+ years experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and MongoDB
Demonstrated experience developing production level code
Strong project management and organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Why we think you will love working with us.

Build something making a difference in the world. Have a big impact at an early-stage, VC-backed software startup. Work with a tight-knit community of experienced entrepreneurs creating socially-mindful technology.

Amazon’s Demand Forecasting team – part of the Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization – develops and deploys sophisticated algorithms that involve learning from large amounts of data in order to forecast the demand of millions of products worldwide. These forecasts are used to automatically order more than $200 million worth of inventory weekly, establish labor plans for tens of thousands of employees, and predict the company’s financial performance. The work is complex and important to Amazon. With better forecasts we drive down supply chain costs, enabling the offer of lower prices and better in-stock selection for our customers.

We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong machine learning, analytical, communication, and project management skills to join our team. As part of a multi-skilled team, you will help identify and solve complex prediction problems to improve forecast accuracy based on new data that were not previously used in forecasting. Also, you will develop metrics and reports to measure our impact on Amazon’s business. In a typical day, you will work closely with retail leads, product managers, engineers, and various business groups.

You are an individual with outstanding analytical and machine learning modeling abilities, excellent communication skills, good business understanding, and technically savvy. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver who enjoys diving into data, is excited about investigations and algorithms, can multi-task, and can credibly interface between technical teams and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities Include:
Build statistical, predictive and machine learning models to drive forecasting accuracy.Ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including data sourcing/collection, ground truth generation, normalization, and transformation.Influence leaders to make thoughtful data decisions to provide the most consistent and usable data for all teams across the company.Combine expert knowledge of statistical methodology and analysis with advanced programming skills to support complex analyzes.Share/develop best practices with other Amazon teams on a global scale.Build metrics, reports and dashboard to analyze key inputs to SCOT Forecasting systems.

Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics or Economics.Knowledge and experience with Agile development practices.Experience in Demand Planning & Forecasting, Supply Chain or Inventory Management is a plus.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive projects to completion.6+ years professional experience in Analytics or other quantitative disciplines.

In the last 6 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 50,000,000 students registered globally. We are currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America, with offices in Burlington, Toronto and India. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning, while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.

We are looking to scale up our data team to keep up with the growth of our development and marketing teams.
Our data team is responsible for all aspects of data ingestion, storage, transformation, and visualizations using our Amazon Web Services infrastructure. You will be working alongside our development, and data science teams to help build and manage all of our data pipelines and create reports and visualizations which are used to help drive crucial business decisions. The work you do here at Prodigy will aid the educational advancement of millions of students
You Will:
Create and manage key business data pipelines
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement process improvements: automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality, etc
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into student learning, customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key metrics
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data acquisition, data-related technical issues and other analytics needs
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader
Support the development of new solutions for batch, real-time data, and analytics use cases that align with business requirements
Maintain and troubleshoot the infrastructure built for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS regions.Work cross-functionally to explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data
What You'll Need:
Experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions, especially data related, using R, Python, and other programming languages
Advanced working SQL knowledge, query authoring (SQL), and experience working with relational databases, such as PostgreSQLWorking familiarity with a variety of different NoSQL databases, such as DynamoDB, Data Warehouses, such as Redshift, and Data Lakes
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets
Experience working with AWS Cloud platforms and related systems: EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Experience in real-time data processing
Ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines
Strong project management, organizational and communication skills
University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Stats, Mathematics. Graduate degree in Data Science related discipline is a strong asset
Bonus Points For :
Experience implementing backend APIs using NodeJS or other programming languages
Experience with Agile software development
Experience with applied Machine Learning techniques

Full health benefits (from day one!)
Gym & learning fund
Flexible hours
Stock options
Snacks & coffee
Games & ping pong

Calgary, ABWe are seeking Junior and Senior Data Scientists for Imperial’s Digital Accelerator's data science group who can solve business problems by leveraging machine learning, optimization and other analytical techniques in a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, strategic partners and subject domain experts

The Upstream Digital Accelerator (UDA) is a new digital accelerator within Imperial conceived to leverage the power of digital technologies (including AI) to solve highly complex problems across Imperial oil and gas operations, spanning conventional, mining, SAGD and other thermal recovery methods.

Operating within an Agile framework, with multi-disciplinary teams, ideas from the business are quickly actioned and converted into usable products (MVPs). To this end the UDA offers a fast-paced, exciting environment and access to a diverse set of problems. Strong support from the CEO and senior management, and a close working partnership with Imperial’s asset team ensure endless opportunities to create significant impact on the business.

With access to massive data sets, immense computation power and challenging, previously unsolved problems, UDA is an ideal place for Data Scientists to push the boundaries of what they know and can achieve. As an example, a recent project saw the use of 60 stacked XGBoost models feed predictions into a custom built numeric gradient descent optimization algorithm on a 100 GB dataset to significantly improve recovery rate from mining operations.
Furthermore, UDA encourages its members to showcase their work to the data science community through publications, conferences and seminars.

As a new and rapidly expanding group within Imperial, the UDA provides a unique opportunity for Data Scientists to pioneer the use of cutting edge analytics in upstream oil and gas.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Work as a member of the Imperial Digital Accelerator with a team of highly talented Data Scientists, led by a Principal Data Scientist, to unlock substantial value from operations
Work on previously unsolved, highly complex, diverse problems across Imperial upstream assets in a fast-paced Agile environment
Understand and translate business requirements into technical, end-to-end execution plans for predictive modeling
Be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to creating production ready predictive models
Work with Principal Data Scientist to set the strategy for analytical execution
Lead efforts in data quality, consistency and correctness
Ensure your models and analytics are tested with the end users and iterate as needed
Communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery
Mentor and guide junior members of the team through the modeling process
Keep up to date with the latest advances in the data science field
Publish innovative and breakthrough work in conferences and journal
Qualifications
Academic:
MS in machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, economics or related quantitative field is preferred
PhD in a quantitative field is an asset

Other:
Experience leading small teams
Experience implementing machine learning algorithms across a range of complex supervised, unsupervised learning problems
Experience working on complex, ill-defined engineering problems
Experience leading end-to-end modeling including translating the business problem into an analytical approach and delivering results
Experience with problems that involves optimization expertise
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audience, excellent communication skills
Strong expertise in operations research and optimization
Previous domain expertise in energy/ industrial goods
Experience working in cross-functional teams, building production quality and large scale deployments in an Agile environment

Start date: May 1, 2019

Location: Calgary, AB
Your benefits
A company committed to career growth - we recruit those who are interested in a career with Imperial and prefer to develop and promote people from within. Our career management process means that you will likely perform a number of unique, challenging roles during your career.
Successful networking and mentoring programs - enables you to spend time with managers from across the organization to learn about other departments and opportunities. Also allows you to connect with peers at a similar experience level.
Commitment to safety, ethics & continuous improvement - these standards are the reason Imperial is an industry leader. You will work for a company that upholds safety and ethics ideals and continues to seek out ways to improve.
Exceptional benefits program - includes competitive savings, retirement, and healthcare plans that you can customize to meet your individual needs. A comprehensive relocation package is provided, if required. Educational and physical fitness financial assistance programs round out our benefits package.
Continuous learning environment - encourages you to augment your skills and capabilities.
If you are talented, driven, and want to make meaningful contributions that really impact environmental, safety and bottom line objectives, then you owe it to yourself to apply with Imperial.
Early Professional Development Program - provides you with the opportunity to specialize in a specific area of expertise or develop skills in a variety of different areas. You will quickly be given large areas of responsibility and will be encouraged to take on stretch assignments as you progress.
Competitive vacation package - provides you with three weeks of vacation (the first year is pro-rated based on your hiring date) and one scheduled Friday off per month and five floating days annually for use at your discretion with approval.
Who we are
A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. No matter what your career path, we provide the platform to elevate your goals and achieve your ambitions, while providing support through wide-ranging programs and benefits.
Other considerations
For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.
We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Eligibility to work in Canada
All applicants who receive an offer of employment must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date. Proof of eligibility shall be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence, Canadian open work permit or receipt from Immigration Canada of an application for a post-graduate work permit. Proof of eligibility must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Proof of eligibility will be required if an offer of employment is made. Failure to provide proof of eligibility at least six (6) weeks prior to the start date may result in the offer of employment being rescinded.

Application deadline: March 24, 2019
Imperial is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals.
In certain situations, Imperial may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions in the company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.

Reference number: 48123-CSE(OC)2019 Closing Date: 2019-03-31

Job Summary
**The big picture**
CSE plays a critical role in the implementation of Canada’s cyber security strategy. To carry out our mission we track cyberthreats around the world, monitor Government of Canada networks to detect and mitigate cyberthreats, and protect information of value to the government. CSE’s data analysts/scientists play a crucial role in generating insight from data-rich environments.

 *What’s in it for you?*
Are you interested in a unique working experience applying data analyst/science skills to a diverse variety of cyber defence problems? At CSE, data analysts and data scientists are motivated by an environment with:
interesting and distinct problems to solve
talented colleagues
encouragement to approach problems from different perspectives
continuous learning and development to maintain a technical edge
opportunities to see the impact of their efforts
If the above description sounds attractive, you should consider CSE for a career in data analysis/science. Data analysts perform data review, data validation, quality control, and cleaning; they develop and evolve Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and data models; they create data processing pipelines to analyze disparate multi-source data; they prepare technical documentation and standard operating procedures; and they ensure data requirements are met for operational reporting, dashboards and ad hoc requests.
Data scientists model real world problems to forecast what might happen; they apply and develop machine learning techniques, they implement algorithms in efficient and scalable ways; they communicate analytical results to others in compelling and visual ways; they help to develop scalable solutions; and they mentor others and help others to communicate and gain understanding about data science.

Position type: Term and indeterminate positions, with a one (1) year probation period.

Salary Range:
UNI 07 level: $78,001 - $91,764
UNI 08 level: $83,250 - $97,942
These positions are currently eligible for a market allowance ranging from an additional $8,366 to $11,000.

Position Requirements
Education
University degree with extensive statistical, computational coursework; for example, physics, math, engineering, economics, data science, computer science, bioinformatics, etc. (preference may be given to those with a graduate degree).

Experience
Experience with extract, transform, load (ETL) activities including cleaning, transforming, and ingesting large, variegated and changing structured and unstructured data
Experience working with databases and database management tools
Experience scripting or programming in at least one open-source programming language (e.g. Python) or a statistical software package (e.g. R)
Experience collaborating with management, software tool developers and software tool users
Asset
Extensive (three years or more) background in software programming or scripting
Experience in developing and applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to find patterns and model, and predict relationships in large, disparate and evolving data sets
Experience in applying and improving machine learning techniques
Experience conducting data analysis and creating compelling communications in visual, verbal and written forms

Language Requirements
English Essential

Who Can Apply
Canadian citizens who can qualify for a Top Secret security clearance conforming to CSE’s standards.

Security Requirements
Candidates must have no criminal record.
The screening process involves a security interview, a polygraph test, a psychological assessment, and a background investigation covering a minimum of your last 10 years history, including credit and financial verifications. Ongoing substance abuse is a factor to be assessed as part of your screening process.

How To Apply
Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application how they meet each EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE criteria. Failure to do so will result in the applicant being screened out of the selection process.

Notes
CSE is a separate organization and is not subject to the Public Service Employment ACT (PSEA). The organization has its own values-based staffing regime and as such, has the flexibility to determine qualifications for positions and how these positions will be assessed in a selection process.
CSE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. CSEC offers an assessment process which will accommodate the needs of persons with disabilities. If you may need such accommodation, please advise us.
Candidates must be able to provide proof of education credentials.
A written test will be used as a screening tool.
An interview and references will follow for candidates who are successful on the screening test.
The entire selection process – tests, interviews, security investigation – may take more than one year.

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Toronto, ONJoin our team

Do you constantly ask why? Do numbers tell you stories? Are you passionate about data? Do you get excited when the r-square is greater than 0.8? Are you committed to uncovering actionable insight? Would you be interested in shaping the future of TELUS’ People & Culture data governance and people analytics strategy?

The P&C, Data Science Consultant is a strategic role that will translate people data into actionable insights that drive business outcomes. This role is fundamental to our analytics and evidence-based approach to decision making and program development in People and Culture.

The ideal candidate is a passionate and results driven individual who has a passion for dissecting vaguely define business challenges with a strong evidence-based perspective and a creative approach to finding the right solution. Your assignment will be to work with the Business Improvement and Analytics team in driving a short and long term strategy that will advance our business through the lens of People and Culture driving data governance, workforce metrics and data science & analytics.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

Reporting to the Manager, People & Culture, Business Improvement and Analytics, the P&C, Data Science Consultant will partner and work closely with the Director, People & Culture Enablement team, People and Culture Leadership Team, and key business partners in the organization.

Here's how
Translate people data into actionable insights that drive business outcomes
Support the People and Culture function by leading initiatives in the areas of data governance, research, metrics reporting, and advanced analytics:
Drive data governance within People and Culture’s HR and HR related data
Design and conduct research activities and/or experiments to uncover knowledge and insights through a hypothesis driven approach
Develop metrics and reporting for strategic operational activities
Leverage advanced analytics to support business relevant insights
Serve as a domain expert on research methods, statistical methods, data governance and analytics
Tell compelling evidence-based stories to aid executives and business leaders in strategy and decision making - providing influential actionable insights
Translate technical concepts into business relevant insights
Business value mindset - recommending actions that will impact the bottom-line
Research external benchmarking and industry trends to provide insight and guidance on People and Culture strategies
Collaborate with subject matter experts across the People and Culture function and the business organization to build relationships that effectively support strategic priorities
Elevate the effectiveness of deliverables, projects, and processes by identifying process improvement opportunities to drive operational efficiency and to generate incremental team capacity to fulfill growing business demands
Lead and advocate cultural team initiatives that educate cross-functional business leaders on evidence-based management, best practices, and business values
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Analytical problem solving skills with the ability to analyze, dissect and illuminate vaguely defined business problems and challenges
Effective consulting skills, exceptional critical thinking with an ability to leverage analytics to develop solutions that support stakeholder business strategy and objectives
Knowledge of predictive modeling and statistical analysis concepts and principles
Highly organized with a demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize high volume deliverables
Ability to execute and deliver complex initiatives and deliverables
Project management
Change management
Ability to build relationships and communicate (verbal and written) with internal and external stakeholders, senior management and executives
Ability to influence without authority
Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to understand and break down complex business issues into manageable pieces in order to develop analytical blueprints to develop recommendations aligned with the big picture solution
Strong attention to detail, analytical acumen, intellectual curiosity, creativity, a proven work ethic, and good communication skills
Technical understanding and aptitude for programming and data processing
Strong ability to work independently, set performance goals and meet deadlines
Self-motivated and self-directed, but with a strong ‘team player’ attitude
With a University Degree
Great-to-haves
4-7 years of equivalent experience
Proven track record in delivering strategic business insights
Experience in communicating and influencing varied stakeholder groups including senior executives and decision makers
Previous experience in an analytical role, preferably in the area of data, metrics and analytics
Previous experience in workforce and talent analytics an asset
Previous experience in programming and data processing an asset
Excel, Macros and Visual Basic

Winnipeg, MBContract$563 - $656 a weekIISD Experimental Lakes Area (IISD-ELA) is one of the world’s most influential freshwater research facilities. It features a collection of 58 small lakes and their watersheds in northwestern Ontario, Canada. For over 50 years, scientists at IISD-ELA have conducted whole-ecosystem experiments and made significant scientific discoveries related to issues such as acid rain, mercury from air pollution, algal blooms and pharmaceutical chemicals in water. The facility is operated by the International Institute for Sustainable Development, an independent think tank headquartered in Winnipeg.

IISD-ELA acknowledges that our research facility is located on Treaty Three lands and the care of these lands during experimentation and restoration to original state is implicit in its mission. Many local schools in the region come to the facility to learn more about the science of aquatic ecosystems and how humans have a role in working with one another to protect these resources.

The unique nature of the IISD-ELA facility and our whole-ecosystem approach to freshwater science provides an opportunity to deliver different kinds of educational programming and community outreach for a wide variety of audiences. IISD-ELA aims to inspire and train the general public and the next generation of research scientists, providing a platform for science education and innovation. This position will be based at IISD offices in downtown Winnipeg, MB, with occasional overnight travel to IISD-ELA.

Responsibilities:

Work with IISD-ELA scientists to improve the collection and curation of scientific datasets.
Develop and implement the digitization of historic environmental datasets.
Assist with IISD-ELA database management.
Explore innovative data fusion and analysis methods, including Machine Learning and Neural Networks.
Other duties as assigned.

Pursuing or holding a bachelor’s or honours degree in biology, statistics, computer science, environmental science, geography or similar disciplines.
Have a strong interest in quantitative methods, data analysis and modelling.
Some experience and comfort with scientific scripting (Python or R preferred).
Eager to modernize one of Canada’s longest-running whole-ecosystem experiments.
Willing and able to occasionally travel to the Experimental Lakes Area from Winnipeg and perform field sampling in remote environments.
Enthusiasm for interdisciplinary methods and self-directed research.
IISD-ELA will require the completion of a criminal record and child abuse registry check.

job_description:
Toronto, ON$67,020 - $94,357 a yearOverview

Position Title: Epidemiologist
Department: Health Promotion, Chronic Disease, Injury Prevention
Duration: Temporary Full-time (12 months) – Externally Funded
Location: 480 University Ave
Compensation Group: AMAPCEO
Position Status: Open
Internal applicants to be considered first
Salary: $67,020 to $94, 357
Posting Date: March 22, 2019
Closing Date: April 5, 2019

The Epidemiologist is responsible for providing specialized epidemiological services to a research team within the department of Health Promotion, Chronic Disease, and Injury Prevention. Specifically, the successful candidate will work on a CIHR funded project entitled, Cardiovascular disease attributable to nutrition-related causes: Estimating future burden and evaluating nutrition policy options for maximizing population health benefit in Canada. This study will inform policies to reduce the nutrition-related CVD burden in Canada. Diets high in sodium and sugar-sweetened beverages (SSB) are strongly linked to cardiovascular disease (CVD), a leading cause of mortality. Given their high prevalence of excess consumption, the Canadian Government has identified sodium and SSBs as high priority policy targets requiring effective interventions. The aim of this study is to estimate the extent to which population-level dietary interventions will reduce sodium and SSBs intake and corresponding population and social inequities in CVD among Canadian adults. The study will use data from the 2015 Canadian Community Health Survey, the first nationally representative nutrition survey in Canada since 2004. We will model the impact of three population-level dietary interventions on sodium and SSB intake, including: 1) sodium reformulation in food; 2) excise tax on SSB; and, 3) mandatory front-of-package nutrition labels. Next, we will use the Cardiovascular Disease Population Risk Tool (CVDPoRT), a validated population-based risk algorithm, to predict the impact of these three population-level dietary interventions to maximize CVD prevention and reduce social inequities in CVD across social groups (i.e., age, sex, socioeconomic status and food security) using CVDPoRT.
Responsibilities

Works under the general guidance of Scientists to coordinate all aspects of the projects.Provides analytical expertise to support research teams’ data, information, knowledge and support goals.Collaborates with internal and external partners to develop data analysis plans.Assists in the preparation of grant submissions and knowledge translation activities, including the preparation of peer-reviewed manuscripts and conference presentations related to ongoing findings of the study.Contributes methodological expertise.Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements

Master’s degree in epidemiology or related field.Minimum 2-4 years of experience as an epidemiologist in a public health or related setting.Experience in analysis and interpretation of survey data.Experience in public health research.

PermanentWhat you'll doResponsibilities
Work with engineering and product development to identify and answer important product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data.
Identify, clean, and munge new and existing data sources.
Communicate findings to management team and clients.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members to rapid prototype new features.
Estimate tasks and participate in status and stand-up meetings.
What you'll needQualifications
BS, BA, or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering or a related field.
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel.
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Working knowledge of an analysis tool such as R, Python, Matlab, or SAS.

Job Summary


Reporting to the VP, Modeling, the Data Scientist will have a critical role for the Genworth MIC modeling team and will strengthen customer-centric data science capabilities. The focus will be on solving business problem(s) using large volume of structured and unstructured data from various data source systems leveraging optimization techniques. A combination of skills from various disciplines such as Operational Research (e.g. Heuristic Algorithms, GA, PSO), Machine Learning (e.g. Unsupervised Algorithms) and Deep Learning (e.g. DQN, RL) is required.


Job Duties


Collect, parse, visualize and analyzes data sets from multiple sources to build Predictive and Prescriptive models using established or emerging open source tools.
Design, develop, and implement start-to-end cloud-based data and AI (Machine Learning and Deep Learning) model pipelines (data exploration, sampling, training data generation, feature engineering, model building, performance evaluation, stability checks, Batch/API deployment, and auto scoring).
Code, test and deploy Data/Model Pipelines to create robust and scalable analytical applications and constantly improve them over time.
Ensures that data pipelines and models are repeatable, secure and will serve multiple user groups.
Translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design to build analytical applications.
Works with peers to ensures that (semi-) automated processes protect data privacy/security and integration process follows data and model governance guidelines.
Contribute to the knowledge body with centralized documentation and code bank and facilitate workshops for the end users.
Work in partnership with various business functions in an agile development environment.
Communicate the results/analysis/visualization precisely and clearly to non-technical users from various business functions.
Identify new opportunities and develop customer-centric analytical solutions meeting business needs aligned to business strategy.
Work with minimal direction, with the proven ability to co-ordinate complex projects and problem-solving mindset.


Job Requirements


Masters or PhD in (Applied) Operations Research/Computer Science/Finance/Economics/Mathematics/Statistics/Physics or any other data and compute intensive field.
Code efficiently in R, Python, JScript, Spark, Shell Scripting, SQL and proficient in Linux OS. Awareness of C/C++/Java would be an asset.

Working knowledge of design thinking and agile prototyping to develop and test business use cases and analytical applications.

Mississauga, ONRequisition ID: 18229
Job Category: Information Technology; Technology

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.

Scope of Position
The mining, infrastructure and energy sectors are coming to terms with the use of new Digital Technologies to improve and even transform their businesses. Fundamental to this is the use of data to solve real world problems from system availability and OEE, to decision support systems that address process variability and asset integrity and advanced process control systems powered by machine learning and other forms of Artificial Intelligence (AI). All of these applications hold the promise of transitioning our clients from people-intensive to a data- and algorithm-intensive industries. Within Hatch Digital, we are aggressively building a business that supports clients to better achieve this goal through the application of a broad range of “industrial mathematical” techniques; data analytics, AI and Machine Learning (ML) to provide broad ranging decision support capabilities for our clients. Our offerings cover the spectrum from business consulting to the supply of bespoke solutions (including software packages). Our decision support teams work in concert with other Hatch Digital teams and our 9000 global subject matter experts to improve insights and outcomes through the application of data. Currently, we are seeking a Senior Data Scientist for our global decision support teams – to take us to the next level.

The Hatch organization is built upon an upbeat, collaborative culture where we are passionately committed to the pursuit of a better world through positive change. Together, we create unprecedented outcome for our clients by partnering with them to develop better ideas. We innovate in all that we do.

The successful candidate will be an entrepreneurial and collaborative thought leader with demonstrated hands-on experience related to the industrial application of data analytics, AI and ML. As a member of the team, you will not only help our clients solve their toughest challenges, but you will also collaborate in a strong, global team of world class, client-focused industrial mathematicians. You will excel at discovering, designing and developing analytical methods to support novel approaches to data and information processing including the development of machine learning algorithms. You will be comfortable with the generation and testing of working hypotheses and will be expert at the preparation and analysis of historical data to identify patterns and trends. You will also provide advice for the ongoing development of Hatch’s cloud-based Knowledge-as-a-Service platform and will support the development of analytical applications for this environment.

This role requires someone who can help clients identify the benefits of applying data analytics, understands the opportunities to use data for prediction, optimization and control across different industries. You will leverage other Hatch capabilities, to successfully and completely tackle industry challenges.

Functional Tasks
Support a world-class global capability in decision support and industrial data science, this will include:
Participate in the enhancement of current Machine Learning and Cognitive Computing capabilities
Formalize a distinct Hatch point of view for our decision support services.
Help build and develop the skills of our existing team.
Assist in the creation of a common architecture for development.
Collaborate with a virtual team along with others involved in this field in Hatch (including Hatch citizen data scientists).
Help Coach and Mentor the data science team to further develop data analytics capabilities.
Own the tools, methodologies and frameworks required to deliver data analytics solutions.
Work with the Digital Leadership team to refine and implement the go to market plan for data analytics.
Work closely with all Digital Sector leaders (Mining, Infrastructure and Energy) to develop a value proposition, message and market positioning to expand into those sectors.
Work with other business units’ leadership and its clients to identify and develop opportunities.
Help Develop new business channels.

Industry Leadership
Strive to be known as a domain thought leader.
Participate in a culture of collaboration with peers and partners.
Support relationships with key partners.
Remain abreast of the industry, competitors and technology trends with a view to ensuring that the firm's services best align to market needs.

Preferred Experience & Education
The following indicates specific industry, academic and functional experience/qualifications that are important to the successful achievement of the identified responsibilities and performance deliverables.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in data analytics in relevant sectors (mining, oil and gas, infrastructure or utilities) coupled with implementation of digital technology solutions.
Very strong technical orientation to industrial data analytics.
Expert in the development of value proposition and business cases, vision and realization roadmap strategy.
Excellent facilitation skills to bring alignment (break silos) between different parts of the client’s organizations.
Proven experience in successfully applying digital technologies / solutions to a very traditional working environment.

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Company Profile
Miovision's mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrows smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the worlds most advanced traffic AI, Miovision innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit
www.miovision.com [http://www.miovision.com/].

Position Summary
Do you know someone who hates the commute to work? Do you want to be part of the solution? Miovision is looking for an exceptional machine learning engineer who is passionate about developing machine learning models and solving cutting-edge problems. The team you would be joining is responsible for training, validating and delivering machine learning models to be used in other parts of the business, ranging from execution environments in the cloud to low power devices installed at the roadside.

Our team makes use of powerful libraries such as tensorflow, opencv, scikit-learn and pyspark to develop algorithms, test and refine our ideas and productize our solutions. We frequently deploy our models and algorithms into internal systems and customer-facing products, so they have immediate impact in various lines of business. In this role, you will have the freedom and responsibility to collaborate on, design, and develop algorithms to solve real problems in computer vision and statistical modelling. Our team values strong problem solving skills, initiative in ensuring that we're building robust solutions, and solid experience with machine learning workflows. This includes the ability to manage large datasets, build efficient workflows and present compelling data analysis.

On this team we work within the agile process. You will directly see the impact of your deliverables pushed to production frequently, being utilized by your colleagues on the team and making their way to customer facing products. You will also have frequent opportunities to demo your work with a wider audience excited to find out about the latest developments coming from our team. Come help us solve traffic problems together, and have fun while doing so!

Things we'd like you to do:

Train, validate and deploy cutting edge machine learning models
Design, conduct and interpret experiments.
Communicate substantiated recommendations based on experimental results.
Participate in dataset definition and gathering activities.
Discuss and implement architecture considerations with the team.
Ensure high quality of work using both manual and automated testing.
Participate in the code review process.
Participate to technical road map discussions and estimation exercises.
Contribute to publishing research papers.
Read research papers to stay on top of latest developments.

A few things we'd like you to have:

Expertise with at least one of: python, c++
Expertise with at least one of: tensorflow, opencv, scikit-learn, pytorch, gluoncv
Strong software development skills
Comfort working on unix systems
Experience with machine learning, preferably in computer vision
Ability to take ownership of delivering complete solutions
Curiosity to dive into technical details of how things work
Creating data visualizations and analyzing data

It'd be great if you also have experience with:

Familiarity with bash scripting
AWS architecture and services
Git version control
Docker
Conda packaging

We are seeking Junior and Senior Data Scientists for Imperial’s Digital Accelerator's data science group who can solve business problems by leveraging machine learning, optimization and other analytical techniques in a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, strategic partners and subject domain experts

The Upstream Digital Accelerator (UDA) is a new digital accelerator within Imperial conceived to leverage the power of digital technologies (including AI) to solve highly complex problems across Imperial oil and gas operations, spanning conventional, mining, SAGD and other thermal recovery methods.

Operating within an Agile framework, with multi-disciplinary teams, ideas from the business are quickly actioned and converted into usable products (MVPs). To this end the UDA offers a fast-paced, exciting environment and access to a diverse set of problems. Strong support from the CEO and senior management, and a close working partnership with Imperial’s asset team ensure endless opportunities to create significant impact on the business.

With access to massive data sets, immense computation power and challenging, previously unsolved problems, UDA is an ideal place for Data Scientists to push the boundaries of what they know and can achieve. As an example, a recent project saw the use of 60 stacked XGBoost models feed predictions into a custom built numeric gradient descent optimization algorithm on a 100 GB dataset to significantly improve recovery rate from mining operations.
Furthermore, UDA encourages its members to showcase their work to the data science community through publications, conferences and seminars.

As a new and rapidly expanding group within Imperial, the UDA provides a unique opportunity for Data Scientists to pioneer the use of cutting edge analytics in upstream oil and gas.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Work as a member of the Imperial Digital Accelerator with a team of highly talented Data Scientists, led by a Principal Data Scientist, to unlock substantial value from operations
Work on previously unsolved, highly complex, diverse problems across Imperial upstream assets in a fast-paced Agile environment
Understand and translate business requirements into technical, end-to-end execution plans for predictive modeling
Be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to creating production ready predictive models
Work with Principal Data Scientist to set the strategy for analytical execution
Lead efforts in data quality, consistency and correctness
Ensure your models and analytics are tested with the end users and iterate as needed
Communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery
Mentor and guide junior members of the team through the modeling process
Keep up to date with the latest advances in the data science field
Publish innovative and breakthrough work in conferences and journal
Qualifications
Academic:
MS in machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, economics or related quantitative field is preferred
PhD in a quantitative field is an asset

Other:
Experience leading small teams
Experience implementing machine learning algorithms across a range of complex supervised, unsupervised learning problems
Experience working on complex, ill-defined engineering problems
Experience leading end-to-end modeling including translating the business problem into an analytical approach and delivering results
Experience with problems that involves optimization expertise
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audience, excellent communication skills
Strong expertise in operations research and optimization
Previous domain expertise in energy/ industrial goods
Experience working in cross-functional teams, building production quality and large scale deployments in an Agile environment

Start date: May 1, 2019

Location: Calgary, AB
Your benefits
A company committed to career growth - we recruit those who are interested in a career with Imperial and prefer to develop and promote people from within. Our career management process means that you will likely perform a number of unique, challenging roles during your career.
Successful networking and mentoring programs - enables you to spend time with managers from across the organization to learn about other departments and opportunities. Also allows you to connect with peers at a similar experience level.
Commitment to safety, ethics & continuous improvement - these standards are the reason Imperial is an industry leader. You will work for a company that upholds safety and ethics ideals and continues to seek out ways to improve.
Exceptional benefits program - includes competitive savings, retirement, and healthcare plans that you can customize to meet your individual needs. A comprehensive relocation package is provided, if required. Educational and physical fitness financial assistance programs round out our benefits package.
Continuous learning environment - encourages you to augment your skills and capabilities.
If you are talented, driven, and want to make meaningful contributions that really impact environmental, safety and bottom line objectives, then you owe it to yourself to apply with Imperial.
Early Professional Development Program - provides you with the opportunity to specialize in a specific area of expertise or develop skills in a variety of different areas. You will quickly be given large areas of responsibility and will be encouraged to take on stretch assignments as you progress.
Competitive vacation package - provides you with three weeks of vacation (the first year is pro-rated based on your hiring date) and one scheduled Friday off per month and five floating days annually for use at your discretion with approval.
Who we are
A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. No matter what your career path, we provide the platform to elevate your goals and achieve your ambitions, while providing support through wide-ranging programs and benefits.
Other considerations
For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.
We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Eligibility to work in Canada
All applicants who receive an offer of employment must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date. Proof of eligibility shall be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence, Canadian open work permit or receipt from Immigration Canada of an application for a post-graduate work permit. Proof of eligibility must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Proof of eligibility will be required if an offer of employment is made. Failure to provide proof of eligibility at least six (6) weeks prior to the start date may result in the offer of employment being rescinded.

Application deadline: March 24, 2019
Imperial is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals.
In certain situations, Imperial may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions in the company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.

job_description:
Toronto, ONResponsibilities

Leverage a data set consisting of millions of user actions per day to create reliable algorithms that predict consumer behavior.
 Design and evaluate novel approaches for handling high-volume real-time data sets.
Run regular A/B tests and statistical analyses to draw conclusions on the impact of your models.
Qualifications
You have a PhD in computer science, applied mathematics, or statistics with a thesis in behavioral analytics, or a thesis grounded in machine learning techniques in a related field.
You have experience analyzing and creating empirically verifiable models based on real-world data, using multiple approaches.
You have experience with a large scale or distributed programming framework (Dataflow, Spark/ Hadoop) and with ML frameworks such as sklearn, TensorFlow/Caffe/PyTorch, H2O

We’re here to help

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the
way people think about a bank.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and networkbuilding opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

At Shopify, we empower 600,000+ entrepreneurs all over the world. We're looking for hard-working, passionate people to help us make commerce better. Duties
The successful candidate will advance the science of predicting, measuring and improving naval ship structural vibrations and the resulting acoustic noise associated with onboard machinery, hydrodynamic excitation, and propeller operation. They will implement those techniques within more holistic simulations of naval platform signatures and performance. They will also advance the science of acoustic signature measurement and suppression within the broader context of onboard naval ship signature management systems.
The successful candidate will develop expertise, create knowledge and conduct research in support of the Canadian Armed Forces. This includes planning and executing experimental research activities, such as laboratory tests and field or sea trials, as well as developing and applying custom and commercial hardware and/or software for scientific modeling, data collection and analysis. In addition to the execution of longer term research projects, they will provide scientific consulting services and recommendations to the Canadian Armed Forces.

The successful candidate will report their research results through reports, peer-reviewed journal and conference papers, verbal presentations and briefings. They will monitor worldwide developments in science and technology in order to identify and assess trends in their field of research. They will also be involved in formulating, implementing and managing large research projects, often involving international partners, industry, academia and consortia.

In carrying out the research program, the successful candidate will supervise and provide guidance to technical staff, contractors and students. They will also participate in national and international scientific meetings and conferences.
Intent of the process
The immediate need will be to staff one position for a specified period of one year.

A pool of qualified or partially qualified candidates may be established from this process and may be used to staff similar positions where tenure, language requirements and security requirements may vary according to the position to be staffed
Positions to be filled: 1

Information on employment equity
1. Candidates must meet the essential qualifications to be appointed to a position
2. All communication relating to this process, including email correspondence and telephone conversations, may be used in the assessment of qualifications
3. Various assessment tools may be used to evaluate candidates (standardized tests, written exam, interview, simulation exercise, reference checks, work samples, publications, reports, etc.)
4. Candidates must ensure that they are available for any testing or interviews required.
5. Proof of education, including transcripts, will be required. Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca.
6. Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.
7. Candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the operational requirements, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed. Candidates may be contacted and assessed against these criteria at any time during this process.
8. Various volume management strategies may be applied at any stage of the selection process such as random selection or top-down selection of candidates and screening based on degree of experience.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.

At MobSquad, we're a team of diverse and curious people who are committed to helping start-ups grow. We write some of the most advanced, useful, and compelling code, and we do it in an environment that values free expression and inquiry. The Squad is bound together by our mutual respect for each other and our hunger to create.

The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a Canada-based team working remotely with a leading US start-up. Your team will operate alongside many other talented developers and data scientists in Canada, and you will be an integral part of the tech community that MobSquad has built.

This role requires someone who has demonstrated an ability to bridge the gap between the theoretical and the practical. The ideal candidate has deployed or attempted to execute Artificial Intelligence theories from various Machine Learning (ML) models and algorithms, and also has some experience in data engineering. MobSquad is looking for proven researchers with a track record of publishing in impactful journals and conferences, or those with years of hands-on industry experience.

This role offers the opportunity to apply your knowledge of statistics and your analytical skills to mine data at scale and develop large-scale ML models to reveal the value in data. You will support feature prototyping and utilize best practices to write production-grade code. You will build data pipelines, implement ML-based analytical algorithms, and work closely with the software development team to set up back-end systems and interfaces that will deliver next-generation analytics.

Qualifications and Skills


An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a comparable analytical field from an accredited institution
Expert in data mining, machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling and data visualization techniques using data-oriented tools and languages such as Python, R, and MATLAB
3+ years experience or demonstrated fluency in relevant programming languages (Python, R, Scala, Java, C/C++/C# a plus)
3+ years experience writing SQL as well as NoSql queries and databases
Experience setting up and using large-scale distributed data-processing frameworks such as Apache Spark and Hadoop Map-Reduce
Experience working with enterprise-grade cloud computing platforms such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS
Demonstrated ability to develop high-quality code adhering to industry best practices (i.e., code review, unit tests, revision control)
Familiarity with designing experiments and collecting data for the purpose of deriving data analytics insights and solutions
Work/project history reflective of a self-motivated professional who excels when given open-ended problems and broadly-defined goals, having an innate desire to discover the patterns and relationships in data that can be leveraged to provide business value

Who You Are


You understand that writing code is as much about functionality as it is about communication, and that shines through in the clarity of your code and how you describe it to your teammates
You are a self-starter who can work autonomously and drive your success within a team
You are comfortable when things go according to plan, and you are energized when chaos strikes and the team's well-laid plans need to be overhauled
You know that start-up life involves continual adaptation and change, and that excites you!

What You'll Get @MobSquad


A full-time position that offers competitive compensation
A benefits program delivered through our bespoke digital platform, giving you control, choice, and flexibility. We give you the ability to build your package of benefits covering health (think medical, dental, vision), wellness (think gym, workout gear, ski pass, massage, transit) and RRSP (think retirement)
A downtown office location with first-rate amenities, surrounded by great restaurants and easily-accessible transit
For international candidates: Sponsorship for an immediate work permit through Canada's Global Talent Stream and in many cases, expedited permanent residency and a path to citizenship

What You'll Experience @MobSquad


Exposure and engagement with world-class start-ups where you will be helping to build the next big thing many times over
A team-based environment where our culture and community are deeply rooted in our core values
A diverse and inclusive workplace; we know conscious and subconscious discrimination exists and we work hard to uncover and remove biases and barriers, so everyone realizes their actual - not perceived - potential
Opportunity. And lots of it.

Company Overview

Solid State Pharma Inc. (SSPI) is a leader in the delivery of crystallization engineering services including screening and selection of polymorphs, co-crystals, salts, and crystallization process development and optimization. SPPI has experienced great success with the workflows that have been developed by combining fundamentals of crystallization and solid form science with years of experience and high throughput techniques. SSPI is conducting research on pharmaceutical crystallization engineering, polymorph screening, salt screening, co-crystal screening, chiral resolution, polymorph quantification, converting amorphous material to crystalline solid, chemical and crystallization process modeling. SSPI is working with a large number of pharmaceutical companies across the globe to help them fully understand the solid state and crystallization of their drug candidates.

About Halifax, Nova Scotia

Halifax is one of the most beautiful and historic cities in Canada. Located on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean, there are numerous parks, campsites, trails and rivers around the city for outdoor activities. City life is also superb. With a population of more than 400,000, Halifax is home to many cultural attractions, museums, art galleries, pubs and clubs. The city hosts three major universities and many community colleges. The beautiful Annapolis valley, which is home to the highest tides in the world, and also mountainous Cape Breton, are within a few hours drive from Halifax. Halifax has one of the mildest winters in Canada as well as one of the most pleasant summers, which you can enjoy on the beautiful water front boardwalk.

Summary

The “Scientist” position is a key contributor to the ongoing research at SSPI reporting to senior scientists or directors. “Scientist” will contribute through conducting solid form screening experiments, characterizing the resulting material, preforming crystallization process development for active pharmaceutical ingredients and natural products through utilizing the physical chemistry knowledge and hands on experiences. It is expected to have 70-80% lab work.

Job Responsibility

Design and preform high throughput polymorph screening, salt screening, solubility measurements and characterization under direction of senior scientist or director.
Design and preform crystallization process development, under direction of senior scientist or director, to achieve desired polymorph and specifications while meeting the specs.
Characterize the generated samples using X-ray Powder Diffraction (XRPD), Differential Scanning Calorimetry (DSC), Thermal Gravimetry Analysis (TGA), Liquid Nuclear Magnetic Resonance
(NMR), Dynamic Vapor Sorption (DVS), Optical Microscope, Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM), Particle Size Analyzer and HPLC.
Record all details of experiments and analytical data
Analyze data that are obtained from experiments and draw conclusions
Use Design of Experiments (DOE) software to perform statistical analysis of generated experimental data
Write high quality weekly and final reports
Routinely present the project results to the team through teleconference
Follow the safety rules and housekeeping principles to ensure all working areas are clean and safe
Other responsibilities as assigned
Education & Experience

MSc (0-3 years related experience) or PhD (0 year), in chemistry, chemical Engineering or related in the areas of crystallization engineering, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, solid state characterization or organic chemistry. Previous experience in crystallization science and engineering is a plus.

Candidates with more experience are encouraged to apply as the title could be adjusted.

Skills

Laboratory techniques for conducting wet chemistry experiments
Knowledge of XRPD, DSC, TGA, STDA, SEM, DVS, NMR, HPLC and particle size analyzer is a plus
Knowledge of crystallization engineering and solid form screening principles is a plus
Knowledge of Process Analytical Technologies (PAT) tools is a plus. Specifically, FBRM, React-IR and PVM
Knowledge of statistical Design of Experiment (DOE) is a must
Experience with DOE software, e.g. Design Expert is a plus
Ability to use Microsoft office software is a must
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present the results are required
Physical Demands

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to talk, hear, see, stand, walk, sit, smell and use hands and fingers, to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to pick up ordinary weights.

Closing date

Open until filled

Calgary, ABData Scientist
Location: Calgary, AB, CA
Company: ExxonMobil
Job description
We are seeking Junior and Senior Data Scientists for Imperial’s Digital Accelerator's data science group who can solve business problems by leveraging machine learning, optimization and other analytical techniques in a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, strategic partners and subject domain experts

The Upstream Digital Accelerator (UDA) is a new digital accelerator within Imperial conceived to leverage the power of digital technologies (including AI) to solve highly complex problems across Imperial oil and gas operations, spanning conventional, mining, SAGD and other thermal recovery methods.

Operating within an Agile framework, with multi-disciplinary teams, ideas from the business are quickly actioned and converted into usable products (MVPs). To this end the UDA offers a fast-paced, exciting environment and access to a diverse set of problems. Strong support from the CEO and senior management, and a close working partnership with Imperial’s asset team ensure endless opportunities to create significant impact on the business.

With access to massive data sets, immense computation power and challenging, previously unsolved problems, UDA is an ideal place for Data Scientists to push the boundaries of what they know and can achieve. As an example, a recent project saw the use of 60 stacked XGBoost models feed predictions into a custom built numeric gradient descent optimization algorithm on a 100 GB dataset to significantly improve recovery rate from mining operations.
Furthermore, UDA encourages its members to showcase their work to the data science community through publications, conferences and seminars.

As a new and rapidly expanding group within Imperial, the UDA provides a unique opportunity for Data Scientists to pioneer the use of cutting edge analytics in upstream oil and gas.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Work as a member of the Imperial Digital Accelerator with a team of highly talented Data Scientists, led by a Principal Data Scientist, to unlock substantial value from operations
Work on previously unsolved, highly complex, diverse problems across Imperial upstream assets in a fast-paced Agile environment
Understand and translate business requirements into technical, end-to-end execution plans for predictive modeling
Be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to creating production ready predictive models
Work with Principal Data Scientist to set the strategy for analytical execution
Lead efforts in data quality, consistency and correctness
Ensure your models and analytics are tested with the end users and iterate as needed
Communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery
Mentor and guide junior members of the team through the modeling process
Keep up to date with the latest advances in the data science field
Publish innovative and breakthrough work in conferences and journal
Qualifications
Academic:
MS in machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, economics or related quantitative field is preferred
PhD in a quantitative field is an asset

Other:
Experience leading small teams
Experience implementing machine learning algorithms across a range of complex supervised, unsupervised learning problems
Experience working on complex, ill-defined engineering problems
Experience leading end-to-end modeling including translating the business problem into an analytical approach and delivering results
Experience with problems that involves optimization expertise
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audience, excellent communication skills
Strong expertise in operations research and optimization
Previous domain expertise in energy/ industrial goods
Experience working in cross-functional teams, building production quality and large scale deployments in an Agile environment
